title: Senior Microsoft Dynamics CRM Developer
description:
Do you have long experience of Microsoft Dynamics CRM and a passion for development? Do you also want to work in a committed project team that together develops innovative solutions for customers? Then you are a perfect fit as a Senior Microsoft Dynamics CRM developer at Releye.


**A workday as a Microsoft Dynamics developer**
-----------------------------------------------


As a Senior Dynamics Developer, you will leverage your extensive experience with Dynamics 365 to design, develop, and implement robust solutions tailored to client needs. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams, offer strategic insights, and deliver top-tier implementations that streamline business operations and enhance customer engagement.


As a Senior Microsoft Dynamics CRM developer, you will have Tech lead responsibility and make sure we follow Releye's methods and DevOps principles as well as taking a role as an architect and solution designer. As a senior developer you are technically responsible for the larger implementations. But you are not alone - we work as a team and help each other.

**Some of your responsibilities:**

* Develop and customize Dynamics 365 solutions to optimize business processes.
* Design workflows, plugins, and custom integrations for complex enterprise applications.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and architect innovative solutions.
* Troubleshoot and resolve Dynamics 365-related issues, ensuring optimal performance.
* Mentor junior developers and contribute to our knowledge-sharing culture.

**We believe you have the following skills and experience:**
------------------------------------------------------------

* 5+ years of Dynamics 365 development, including Customer Engagement (Sales, Service, Marketing, Field Service).
* Working with Azure services.
* Working with Power Platform, Power automate and cloud flows.
* Expertise in C#, JavaScript, SQL, CRM plugins, workflows
* Experienced in working with CRM integrations
* Working as a consultant.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically.
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

### **Meritorious is also:**

* Experience of solution design, designing integrations and architecture experience
* Certification within Microsoft Power platform or Dynamic 365 Customer Engagement.
* Previous work with migration from older to newer versions of Dynamics or other CRM platform.

**Förmåner**
------------


* Sociala happenings - After Works, fredagsfrukostar, team-aktiviteter och fester. Vi gillar att hitta på roliga saker tillsammans och tror på att blanda nytta med nöje.
* Centralt kontor - Mitt i centrala Stockholm, på Kungsgatan, finns vårat kontor. Ett kontor vi delar med våra syskonbolag Attollo och Omeo. Här finns mängder av härliga lunchrestauranger och caféer att testa med kollegorna.
* Tekniska utmaningar - Vårt intresse för IT skapar gemenskap och spännade utmaningar. Vi utvecklas ständigt genom att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Salesforce och Microsoft.
* Kompetensutveckling - Mentorskapsprogram, R&D-day och uppmuntran till certifieringar, är några av fler aktiviteter som vi har kopplat till kompetensutveckling på Releye.
  

  

**Releye**
----------


Releye är ett familjärt strategi- och IT-företag som Automatiserar, Digitaliserar och Transformerar kundprocesser, och ser till att de anpassas till den nya digitala världen. Vi är specialister inom Microsoft CRM och Salesforce och vi är stolta över att ha några av Sveriges mest kända varumärken som våra kunder. Tillsammans med våra kunder tar vi fram proaktiva kundupplevelser.


Releye växer och behöver dig som värdesätter härliga kollegor, utmanande kundprojekt och en utvecklande arbetsplats. Vi har innovationsdagar, lösningar i absoluta framkant och ett skönt framåtlutat gäng som vill bli fler.

  


**Telefon:** 0709446760


**E-post:** jobba@releye.se


**Plats:** Kungsgatan 44, 111 35 Stockholm
Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

  

För mer information, vänligen kontakta:


Cecilia Landin  

HR Business Partner  

cecilia.landin@releye.se  

+46 (0)790 98 76 76

title: Database Developer
description:
#### **Role overview**


Are you like us and enjoy working with the latest technology to build modular and scalable systems? Then Tradedoubler may be the place for you. We are looking for a PL/SQL developer who wants to help with developing our services that are running in our Oracle database. As we are one of the first companies that moved to the Exadata X9M Cloud Service, you will work with the latest Oracle technology!  

We offer a stimulating work environment with varying work tasks which you greatly influence. The work environment is creative and collaborative and our flat organizational structure with strong international atmosphere promotes communication and sharing of ideas. We offer an environment where the business is important, but enjoyment and balance of life is encouraged and recognized.  

Together with your colleagues you will have the possibility to greatly influence the technical development and the development of our products. You will contribute in everything from design and architecture to implementation, test, maintenance, and support of our Oracle database.#### **Main Responsibilities**

* Provide senior technical expertise for our Oracle database to other teams.
* Continuously design, develop, and deploy new services with focus on high availability, high performance, low latency, and scalability.
* Contribute as a member of a highly competent and cross functional team.

#### **Your profile**

**Professional skills**  

* Required
	+ At least 4 years of experience as a PL/SQL developer.
	+ Knowledge of relational database design and how to do optimize performance using for example data partitioning and SQL tuning.
	+ Excellent SQL language skills.
	+ Knowledge of Git.
	+ You have worked with scalable systems and high-volume transaction applications.
	+ Excellent written and verbal communication in English.
* Not required, but beneficial:
	+ Experience with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).
	+ DBA skills like patching and restoring Oracle databases.
	+ Experience of testing frameworks like utPLSQL.
	+ Scripting in Bash.
	+ Automated configuration of environments using tools like Ansible.
	+ Experience from online marketing and/or e-commerce.

 **Personal qualities*** You quickly pick up an understanding of the business you are working with and can convert that knowledge into technical solutions that fulfil client needs and system requirements.
* You act, are self-driven and are used to share your knowledge with others.
* You like to think outside the box and contribute with innovative ideas.

#### **Why us?**


Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.


We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.

#### **About us**


Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.  

In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).  

  

Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.  

  

One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Frontend and CMS Developer
description:
### **Requirements**


* Their role will be to understand business needs, collaborate on requirement definitions, and ensure alignment with the main architects, product teams, and other stakeholders.
* The consultant will work through all phases of the software development lifecycle, including building, testing, deploying, and then operating the platform capabilities.
* Technologies include CMS solutions like Optimizely CMS, open-source eCommerce platforms, and strong front-end knowledge (Bootstrap UI).
* The platform utilizes Azure services, including Azure app services, functions, SQL database, Cosmos DB, and Azure Service Bus.
* The UX specialist will collaborate with product teams, business stakeholders, and developers to ensure that the user experience aligns with business objectives and technical requirements.
* Their responsibilities will include designing user interfaces that are intuitive and engaging, conducting user research, and testing designs. The UX specialist will work across all stages of the design process, from gathering requirements, wireframing, prototyping, testing, and final design implementation.
* They will work closely with developers to ensure designs are effectively translated into the final product, and help optimize the overall user experience for the platform.

title: iOS Developer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
Start: ASAP


Duration: 30/6 plus possible extension


Location: Stockholm - Hybrid

 **Job Descriptions**  

We are seeking an experienced iOS Consultant to join the Payment Experience Team to create a fantastic payment experience for our users and their customers. This is an exciting opportunity to work on interesting problems together with talented peers in a cross-functional agile team. You will create modern digital products that affect people’s lives for the better.

 **Your way to impact**


In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with skilled and highly motivated engineers specializing in backend, iOS, Android, and quality assurance to deliver a world-class experience for our users. You'll benefit from their extensive delivery experience, accelerating your learning journey and enabling you to contribute to exciting features and improvements in the Payment and Orders Experience areas, serving customers at scale across multiple geolocations.

 **Your day to day**

* You will help to deliver high quality solutions to our users.
* You will work as part of an agile team, planning, refining, delivering and inspecting sprint deliveries.
* You work closely with product and design to understand context and vision.

 **What you need to succeed**

* Good experience in iOS development, with good knowledge of Swift.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

 **Top Skills**

* Good experience in iOS development, good knowledge of Swift
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable code with a focus on code quality and experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing.
* Familiarity with iOS SDK and various Apple's frameworks and understand how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* Understanding of common architectural patterns such as MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane to streamline the build, test, and deployment process.

title: Senior App/Web Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Senior App/Web Developer for routing functions.  

Experience with Development Frameworks such as Flutter and React. Ability to design user-friendly and visually appealing interfaces. Part of small team that recently began development but are now scaling up.  

  

Education:  

Master of Science in IT/Computer Science subject or similar experience
  

  

Language:  

English (fluent)
  

  

Meriting:  

Experience with larger projects or apps
  

Have worked with maps/Google Maps before  

  

**Application deadline:** 07-02-2025

  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Simulation C++ Developer
description:
**Company Overview**


Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects as-a-service across a spectrum of domains including Air & Space, Electromagnetic & Cyber, and Synthetic. Metrea Management provides central services to eleven (11) global capability units via Operations, Solutions, Strategy, Legal, and Finance teams

**Capability Unit Overview**


Metrea Simulations (MSIM), redefines the cutting edge of flight simulation and services. Our expertise in physics, engineering and artistry allows us to leverage modern technologies in new and unprecedented ways in order to create the most realistic and immersive flight simulation training products and experiences possible. Through our technologies, customers enjoy an optimal path to efficient training, design, technology development and tactical analysis across the aviation sector. Our technology nucleus of advanced AI, flight and sensor modeling enables us to augment reality through the lens of next-generation products and services.

**Position Summary**


Metrea Simulations is looking for experienced C++ programmers to join our team creating our core large scale simulation platform as well as simulation systems for different military aircraft. As a Simulation C++ programmer, you will work closely with our experts in aerospace and military simulations to create an immersive simulated world with complex and realistic agent behavior and a rich pattern of life. You will support specialized team members with a variety of programming tasks. If you are looking forward to solving hard technical problems and can delve deep into understanding the underlying codebase while keeping performance in mind, we will be a good match for you.


This role will require you to be a team player who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary environment and expects you to be communicative and independent in your work. You should be motivated to find creative and scalable solutions for complex problems.

**Role and Responsibilities**


 As a Simulation C++ programmer, you will develop various systems within our simulation software. We have a broad range of tasks to take on and we will try our best to match your skillset with the items in our backlog. Typically, as a part of a team, you will be responsible for delivering new, or expanding existing systems related to vehicle simulations, that also includes reviewing code from colleagues. The list of skills and experience we look for is quite broad, we don’t expect you to know everything, but we anticipate that you should tick at least a few of those boxes.

**Skills and Experience**

* Experience with Unreal Engine C++ programming
* Experience with Perforce
* UI/UX design and/or UI programming experience
* Experience from the video game industry
* Passion for anything aerospace-related
* Experience with simulation training tools development
* Experience with large-scale games or simulations
* Experience with wargames
* Experience working with international teams
* Background in related fields (e.g., Military, Aerospace, Software, Engineering, Physics, Math)

**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**

* Engineering degree
* 5+ years of professional C++ programming

**Our Culture**


Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.

**Right to Work**


The employee will have the legal right to work in the United States and will be able to produce right to work documentation.

 **Equal Opportunities Statement**  

 Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**  

 This is a full-time (40hrs/week) position.

**Work Location**


Remote

**Travel**


The role will require occasional travels

title: Senior fullstackutvecklare med backend-fokus
description:
Är du en driven utvecklare med passion för backend och vill vara med och bygga framtidens SaaS-lösningar inom B2B-frakt? Zendr söker nu dig som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och bli en del av vårt växande team!
### **Om Zendr**


Zendr är ett snabbväxande och lönsamt tech-bolag som revolutionerar B2B-frakt. Vår plattform gör det enkelt för företag att jämföra fraktpriser, boka och hantera sina transporter på ett ställe, med stöd av ledande transportörer som DHL, FedEx och UPS. Vi har en kultur präglad av innovation, positiv energi och stark teamkänsla.


Med kontor vid vackra Frösundavik i Stockholm, DoSpace i Linköping samt GRO36 i Jönköping, kombinerar vi moderna arbetsmiljöer med flexibilitet. Hos oss värdesätts idéer från alla medarbetare, och du har möjlighet att verkligen sätta din prägel på vår resa framåt.


### **Om rollen**


Som Senior Fullstackutvecklare med backend-fokus hos Zendr kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av vår nya plattform. Tillsammans med vårt engagerade tech-team kommer du att:


* Designa och implementera robusta backend-lösningar med hjälp av TypeScript och NodeJS.
* Utveckla och optimera REST API:er för att möjliggöra effektiva integrationer.
* Säkerställa hög kodkvalitet genom att skapa och underhålla automattester.
* Arbeta med moderna ramverk som ExpressJS och teknologier som MongoDB.
* Samarbeta med frontendutvecklare och andra avdelningar för att skapa värdefulla lösningar för våra kunder.

Du får möjlighet att påverka både tekniska val och arkitektur i ett avgörande skede av företagets tillväxtresa.


### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk bakgrund och är van vid att ta ansvar i utvecklingsprojekt. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:


* Har minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som utvecklare, med fokus på backend.
* Är bekväm med att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö.
* Har en högskoleutbildning inom Data/IT eller motsvarande.
* Har 3–4 års erfarenhet av TypeScript och NodeJS.
* Är van att arbeta med Express, API-design (RESTful) och automattester.
* Erfarenhet av MongoDB, AWS och React är meriterande.

### **Vad vi erbjuder dig**


På Zendr får du möjlighet att arbeta i en framåtblickande och inspirerande miljö. Vi erbjuder:


* En central roll i utvecklingen av vår nya plattform.
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden, inklusive möjligheten till distansarbete.
* En arbetsplats som präglas av samarbete, gemenskap och teknisk innovation.
* Möjlighet att påverka och göra skillnad i ett snabbväxande företag.

### **Placering**


Tjänsten kan tillsättas i Stockholm, Jönköping eller Linköping.


Är du den vi söker? Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens fraktlösningar? Ansök nu och bli en del av Zendrs fantastiska team!


### **Övrig information**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar Zendr med Tech Talents. Vi tillämpar kontinuerligt urval vilket innebär att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan slutdatumet. Har du frågor kring tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryterare: Ellen Plym ellen.plym@techtalents.se eller 076-148 12 35.


Välkommen med din ansökan!


#### **Företag:** **Zendr**


#### **Plats:** **Jönköping**


#### **Sista ansökningsdatum:**

#### **Kontaktperson:** **Ellen Plym**
**ellen.plym@techtalents.se**
**+46761481235**

title: Senior Javautvecklare (8862)
description:
Vill du arbeta i ett innovativt företag som är världsledande inom robotteknik och bidra till en mer hållbar värld? DeLaval är den största utvecklaren, tillverkaren och leverantören av lösningar för mjölkproduktion globalt. Vi har varit pionjärer inom lantbruksinnovation i över 100 år.  


**Om tjänsten**  

DeLaval erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö där du blir en del av spännande projekt och får möjlighet att utvecklas både professionellt och personligt. Du kommer att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och bidra till att forma framtidens lösningar inom robotstyrning, användargränssnitt och realtidsstyrning. Majoriteten av programvaran utvecklas i Java. Du kommer att arbeta med systemutveckling i ett agilt team där ni tillsammans ansvarar för både utveckling och förvaltning.  


**För att lyckas och trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du:**
* Har en examen från teknisk utbildning på högskole-/universitetsnivå.
* Erfarenhet av programmering i Java. Har du även kunskap kring C/C++ och Python så är det en merit.
* Behärskar både engelska och svenska i tal och skrift, då vi är ett internationellt företag.

  


**Som person är du:**
* Ansvarstagande med handlingskraft och förmåga att fatta egna beslut.
* Självständig men också en lagspelare.
* Strukturerad med förmåga att planera och prioritera.
* Kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och praktiskt lagd.
* Nyfiken och gillar att vara nyskapande

  


**Vad vi erbjuder**  

Hos oss på DeLaval så har vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö som värdesätter mångfald och främjar en kultur av samarbete och kontinuerligt lärande. Dessutom erbjuder vi:
* En trygg anställning och förmåner från kollektivavtalet (tjänstepension, arbetsrelaterad olycksfallsförsäkring).
* Föräldraledighetsersättning (ca 10 procent av den anställdes månadslön).
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr/år.
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring.
* Flexibla arbetstider och arbetstidsförkortning.
* 30 dagars semester.

  


**Övrig information**  

Det här är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering vid DeLavals huvudkontor i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplatsmodell, som ger flexibilitet att arbeta på distans.  


Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post, men om du har frågor angående rollen eller rekryteringsprocessen, tveka inte att kontakta oss.  


**Kontakt**  

Rekryterande chef: Kattis Karttunen, kattis.karttunen@delaval.com  

Rekryterare: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com  


**Om DeLaval**  

Vår vision är att möjliggöra hållbar livsmedelsproduktion. Vi är ett företag byggt på innovationer, vi arbetar ständigt med att hitta sätt att hjälpa våra kunder, mjölkproducenter, att göra mer med mindre genom att tillhandahålla världsledande mjölkningsutrustning och lösningar.  


Idag har DeLaval cirka 4,500 passionerade medarbetare, verksamma på över 100 marknader världen över. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval Group.
Läs mer på corporate.delaval.com

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
At HMS Industrial Networks, we value the tremendous contributions of our employees, and we recognize that it is our people that make HMS successful. We work hard to maintain our vibrant, innovative, and welcoming culture, and we strive to support our staff as they grow and develop both personally and professionally.



We are looking for an Embedded Software Developer to join one of our software teams. Are you curious by nature, passionate about technology, and excited about low-level C/C++ programming? Do you enjoy collaborating, innovating, and taking ownership? If so, we’d love to hear from you!


### **ABOUT THE ROLE**



You’ll become part of one of our highly skilled and collaborative software teams developing software for world-leading industrial network products.



Industrial applications depend on the performance of their networks. That’s why our software must meet demanding standards for fast data transfer, low latency, and high reliability. Security and protection are just as important.
  

This is what we know today - and now we are moving into an exciting phase where we continue shaping the future of industrial automation and are building a new platform for the future.


##### **Key responsibilities and tasks:**


* Design, develop, and maintain embedded software for industrial communication products.
* Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define software requirements and deliver scalable, future-ready solutions.
* Explore new technologies and contribute to innovation initiatives.
* Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize code to ensure high performance and reliability.
* Work with automated and continuous testing systems.
* Perform validation tests to maintain high reliability and conformity standards.


We have a prestige-free working environment, where everyone wants to share their knowledge and help each other. While we enjoy working together at our Halmstad office, you’ll also have the option to work remotely a couple of days a week.



We regularly celebrate successes, socialize through various activities, and engage in forums like book clubs, developer forums, or department Hackathons—often fueled by snacks, pizza, and lots of energy.


### **ABOUT YOU**



You are a curious and continuous learner and you thrive on solving problems. You enjoy working in a team environment, contributing to group discussions, and collaborating across departments to drive forward and achieve common goals. Your structured approach to development will help ensure that projects are delivered on time without sacrificing quality.



We assume that you have previous experience with embedded C/C++ coding, since it will be part of your daily work. Knowledge about industrial protocols and hardware is meritorious. Whether you’re early in your career or a seasoned professional, we’re eager to meet candidates who share our passion for technology and continuous learning.


##### **Skills and experience:**


* Experience in embedded C/C++
* Python knowledge

##### **It’s a plus if you have worked with:**


* Development or testing of physical products
* Industrial networks (e.g., EthernetIP, PROFINET, EtherCAT)
* Jenkins
* Git
* TLS
* TCP/IP

### **ABOUT US**



At HMS, we believe that connecting matters in everything from making machines talk to engaging with our customers. Our state-of-the-art technology provides a fast and easy way to network millions of industrial devices all over the world. From factory automation to connected buildings, remote solutions, and future technologies, we provide innovative solutions that save you time and money creating a more productive and sustainable world. HMS stands for Hardware Meets Software ™.



HMS is a truly international company, and we like to think that we share a common culture. Heart, Mind and Soul is a summary of how we do things (makes for a pretty good abbreviation too).



Welcome to HMS, this is HMS!



### **ABOUT THE APPLICATION**



HMS is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.



Join us in pushing the boundaries of technology and making a significant impact in the industry. Apply today and be part of a team that values your unique perspective and expertise!



The selection process will be conducted after the application date.



If you want to know more about the role, please contact recruiting manager Malin Sjögren, masj@hms.se. If you want to know more about the recruitment process, please contact responsible HR.



Welcome with your application!
company_description: HMS is Moving Healthcare Forward

title: Business Developer, Data Center
description:
WHAT'S THE ROLE


The Business Developer is a technical sales role, forming part of the global Hilti Business Development community. You will create a strategy and lead its execution to increase adoption of Hilti solutions. You will also coordinate with the local and global team associated with these account(s). As a Business Developer you will proactively develop business opportunities through a selected portfolio of accounts and project involved in the Data Centre industry. Your main focus will be on Data Centre accounts (Owners, EPCs, General Contractors, Consultants) operating in the segment. Your aim will be to maximise Hilti's sales potential with these customers by providing a high standard of technical service and engineering consultancy.


WHO IS HILTI?


At Hilti, we are a passionate global team committed to making construction better. As a trusted partner for productivity, safety, and sustainability, we provide our customers innovative solutions that impact the buildings, roads, and infrastructure people rely on every day.  

  

Hilti is where individuals grow lasting careers by exploring possibilities, maximizing their potential, owning their development, and making a real difference every day.
WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?


In the role you will be responsible and accountable for:  

  



* Development of Data Centre accounts (Owners, EPCs, General Contractors, Consultants) operating in the segment through account standardization, project specification, sales development (direct or indirect) and multi-level relationship management.
* Development of the strategy of the assigned accounts and segment game plans and leading its implementation.
* Building and having ownership of a data center project pipeline identifying largest business opportunities for Hilti in these projects.
* Proactively build-up and participate project capture teams to drive the aligned focus projects and increase share of wallet and ensuring projects are executed as planned from design to construction
* Bringing market intelligence inputs to the teams to confirm and/or update segment strategies.
* Maintaining effective communication throughout the team and company and acts as owner of assigned accounts.

Responsibilities includes travelling abroad when needed.
**93% of our people say they’re proud to work for Hilti, thanks to the quality of our products and the way we look after our people. We’re proud to be considered as a Great Place to Work.**

WHAT DO WE OFFER?


Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.


WHAT YOU NEED IS:


* Previous experience with working on the Data Center projects and ideally MSc/BSc degree in commercial, mechanical or civil engineering.
* Excellent communication skills and creation of trust through active listening, influencing with leadership and not authority.
* Long-term strategic thinking with capability of explaining and transmitting the targets & strategy to customers, peers and management. Ability to plan a week, a month, a year in accordance with the strategy.
* Ability to influence internal and external stakeholders around the strategy while understanding external stakeholders’ pain points and trends to adjust it if need be.
* Ability to work self-driven and autonomously by creating own planning and tasks to reach the targets
* Skill of identifying, understanding and delivery of sharp high-level system selling value proposition and ready to go into the details.
* Senior relationship management: Capable and confident while speaking to senior and C-level customers.
* Business development/sales experience for engineered products or sales of technical solutions.
* Project management capabilities: Manage complexity of system selling across multiple geographies, functions and customers.
* Networking skills (internal and external) with confidence while working within a matrix

WHO SHOULD APPLY?


We have an excellent mix of people and success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.

title: BackEnd Developer
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.  

  

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
Background
Alfa Laval is currently on a digital transformation journey. As part of this transformation, we have created a global organization (70+ people) to strive for a superior and personalized digital customer journey. We are setting ourselves up to work agile, based on the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) framework. During 2021-2022 we are gradually onboarding new teams and for this reason we are now looking for an engaged fullstack developer - curious to learn and evolve.
About the job
We are looking for an additional member of our team developing various kinds of web facing solutions within our value stream. Since we have an agile setup with SAFe we do all planning and estimation as a team creating the right workload for the team.
Key tasks:* Analysis, design, develop, build, configure, test and deploy changes to optimize existing solutions
* Ensure that solutions meet requirements outlined in the design documentation to agreed time, cost and quality within their area and level of expertise.
* Project management of activities, deliveries or smaller, less complex projects, depending on experience.


Who are you?
You are a strong analytical person with problem-solving skills and attention to detail and quality of output. Being part of a team is something that gives you energy and that extra push. You´re structured and driven, with the ability to see the big picture, self-motivated with the ability to effectively prioritize, take initiative and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
What you know
A lot of experience is not required for this position, but you have a good understanding of the solutions, systems and technology within their area and level of expertise. Our environments are based on Microsoft technology with solutions both on-prem as well as in cloud setups. As a developer you know and feel comfortable with technologies and methods such as Web development in .NET MVC/Web api, C# and Git. Experience with-in .NET Core and Azure is nice to have.
For more information, please contact  

Marcus Nelson, IT Manager - Digital Services at marcus.nelson@alfalaval.com
Manal Mohamed, Talent Acquisition Partner at manal.mohamed@alfalaval.com
For Unions information, please contact:
Bror Garcia Lantz at bror.garcialantz@alfalaval.com
Stefan Sandell at stefan.sandell@alfalaval.com
Johan Ranhög at johan.ranhog@alfalaval.com
Our commitment to integrity
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.
We are reviewing applications continuously, make sure to send in yours as soon as possible. Please, send in your application as soon as possible and not later than, February 10th 2025.
Due to GDPR we don’t accept applications sent directly via email.
#LI-MM1

title: BI-Developer
description:
Do you want to make a difference through your daily work? As an employee at Ragn-Sells, you do, regardless of your role in the company. Because our work contributes to a better society and a better environment. In addition, we operate in an exciting future-oriented industry where our solid history and extensive know-how are an enormous strength. As a company, we want to prove that care for the earth and good business go hand in hand.



We are looking for a solution oriented developer to join our team. We are searching for a curious and open-minded person interested in new opportunities.



As a BI-developer at Ragn-Sells, you’ll be a part of a cross-functional team together with other colleges with different tech and business competences.


**What will you do?**



As a BI-developer in one of our teams, you will have a key role in development of brand new features, contributing to architecture discussions, technology choices and communication of technical topics to non-technical stakeholders.



Your tasks and responsibilities:


* Professional approach to work, a strong sense of responsibility to the customer


* Ability to focus on delivering a high-quality code and take responsibility for the entire code lifecycle


* Innovativeness, problem-solving skills, open-mindedness, and can-do attitude thriving in challenging situations.


* Work with the lifecycle management team to support the different Ragn-Sells business units, delivering technically sustainable IT solutions.


* Fluent in English and Swedish (required).


**Who are you?**



You are a creative thinker, a self-motivated team player and collaborative partner. You use creative coding skills to encourage the team to think beyond the expected and deliver high-quality experiences.



Next to this you bring:


* Proficient in MS SQL Server development (SSRS, SSAS, SSIS) on prem.


* Knowledge in developing interactive and visually compelling reports in Power BI and Sematic models.


* Proficient in Azure analytics components, such as Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks and Azure Synapse


**What we can offer you?**


* Work within one of Sweden's most important industries


* A pleasant workplace with good and competent colleagues


* Obviously good employment conditions with collective agreement, pension, health care allowance, etc.


**Other**



Submit your application no later than 23 Februari, 2025. Please note that we review applications continuously and may fill the position before the application deadline, so don’t wait to apply!



The position is full-time and starts from our office in Sollentuna. Ragn-Sells continues to have a flexible workplace where, depending on the role, you have the opportunity to combine home work with work from the office. We apply a six-month probationary period for all positions.



Ragn-Sells is one of Sweden's leading competence companies in recycling and the environment. We collect, treat and recycle waste and residual products from businesses, organizations and households all over Sweden. Our experienced and professional employees believe in simple solutions, taking responsibility, holistic view and forward thinking. We are roughly 1600 employees in Sweden. The Ragn-Sells group is also present in Denmark, Norway and Estonia. In total, we are about 2500 people in the entire group and in 2023 the group had a turnover of about SEK 8,5 billion.

title: Frontendutvecklare
description:
Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling.  



**IT-avdelningen på KTH**


KTH:s IT-avdelning ingår i KTH:s verksamhetsstöd och består av runt 150 anställda. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar IT miljö inom utbildning, forskning och den administrativa plattformen på KTH, en IT miljö som är både komplex och mångfacetterad. Avdelningens ambition är att vara en attraktiv arbetsplats med god arbetsmiljö präglad av öppenhet och med goda förutsättningar till utveckling för alla medarbetare oavsett identitetsuttryck, bakgrund eller ålder.

**Vi söker en driven och nyfiken frontendutvecklare med en passion för modern systemutveckling och innovativa lösningar.**

Hos oss blir du en del av KTH:s identitetsteam, där vi driver en stor satsning för att modernisera och förbättra vår identitets- och åtkomsthantering. I en verksamhet som KTH:s är tusentals individer aktiva. Studenter och forskare och rör sig i allt större utsträckning både nationellt och internationellt. Detta ställer höga krav på robusta och flexibla lösningar, där du kommer att spela en nyckelroll. Vi arbetar med teknologier som React, Java, Spring Boot och Azure för att utveckla skalbara och säkra applikationer, microservices, API:er och moderna systemintegrationer.


Är du redo att bidra till denna digitala transformation och ta dig an komplexa tekniska utmaningar? Då är det dig vi söker!

### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Du kommer att tillhöra ett engagerat team som ansvarar för utveckling av befintliga och nya webbapplikationer inom identitetsområdet. Som frontendutvecklare kommer du tillsammans med arkitekter, verksamheten och produktägare ta fram rätt lösningar för universitetets utmaningar. Du kommer jobba med design, integration, utveckling, kvalitetssäkring och felsökning av de tjänster teamet bygger. Vi sätter stor vikt i lärande både i vardagen och på längre sikt. Det innebär att du kommer ha en personlig utvecklingsplan som ger dig goda förutsättningar att växa i rollen.

### **Vi erbjuder**

* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö


Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH samt våra förmåner.

### **Kvalifikationer**

**Krav**

* Eftergymnasial utbildning på minst 2 år inom IT
* Flera års erfarenhet av utveckling i ReactJS
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med responsiv design för mobil- och desktop-miljöer
* Erfarenhet med integration av frontend applikationer mot olika externa och interna API:er
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Erfarenhet av server-side rendrering med Express och NodejJS
* Erfarenhet av att koda och designa REST API:er

**Personliga egenskaper**


I rollen som frontendutvecklare är det viktigt att ha en problemlösande analysförmåga. Du behöver vara självgående och initiativtagande då en del av arbetet kräver egen planering och utförande, men större delen görs tillsammans med utvecklingsteam, användare och andra intressenter. Vi letar därför efter en engagerad frontendutvecklare som är flexibel och har en hög samarbetsförmåga.

**Meriterande**

* Eftergymnasial utbildning på minst 2 år inom datavetenskap eller systemvetenskap
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med lösningar i Azure
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med BankID eller Freja ID
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med identitetslösningar
* Erfarenhet av OAuth2 och OpenID
* Erfarenhet av Java, Spring, Spring Boot eller .NET core
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och Docker
* Erfarenhet av att designa webbapplikationer för tillgänglighet, samt kunna testa användbarheten med olika verktyg, som t.ex. skärmläsare
* Erfarenhet av React hooks, useReducer, useContext och React Router
* Erfarenhet av Vite


Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

### **Fackliga representanter**


Kontaktuppgifter tillfackliga representanter.

### **Ansökan**


Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).

### **Om anställningen**


Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.  

Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.

### **Övrigt**


Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund


För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.


Om anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass, krävs en godkänd säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) för att bli behörig. Information om tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass ges i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.


Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.

  

Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här

description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker just nu flera kompetenta konsulter för att stärka upp ett team inom elektronik och mjukvaruutveckling. Projekten är spännande, långsiktiga och relaterade till utvecklingen av nya styrskåp för målningsrobotar.


* Arbeta med utveckling av firmware för styrskåp med fokus på hårdvarunära programmering.
* Projektet är inriktat mot Cylink-teknologi.
* Detaljer om arbetsfördelning mellan Norge och Sverige är ännu inte klara, men arbetet sker 100 % på plats.


**Projektstart:**



* Februari/Mars (slutgiltig bekräftelse av projektstart väntas inom kort).

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Mycket erfaren inom VHDL eller hårdvarunära mjukvaruutveckling.
* Svenska språkkunskaper är inte ett krav, engelska fungerar utmärkt.

### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry är ett entreprenörsdrivet konsultföretag som bär fanan högt när det gäller omtanke för varandra och vår omvärld. Vårt mål är att förbättra morgondagen för våra kunder genom våra konsulters kunskap, drivkraft och nyfikenhet. Hos oss finns ett underbart team projektledare i Västerås med blandad erfarenhet och bakgrund som tillsammans expanderar vår verksamhet och upptäcker nya områden.



Sigma samarbetar med en rad olika företag inom flera branscher och våra uppdrag handlar ofta om teknik i framkant. Hos oss har du möjlighet att lära dig något nytt eller arbeta inom områden som du redan är trygg och erfaren inom. Hos oss lär vi oss av varandras erfarenheter och har roligt tillsammans. Vi anser att kunskapsutbyte, gemenskap och korta beslutsvägar är nyckeln till framgång.
