title: Head of IT Security Assurance Frameworks
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


The IT Security Team are a global unit tasked to develop and maintain the central IT Security Framework, drive risk management and supporting internal and external audits related to IT Security and supervise Ericsson’s IT Security posture by continuously assessing the efficiency of IT Security controls across all Information Technology environments within Ericsson.


In this role you will have the chance to be part of a hard-working distributed team dedicated to fulfilling Ericsson’s emerging journey building a strong, resilient, purposed and balanced IT Security capability. Mandated to protect our company assets from emerging threats and risks, you will together with your colleagues lead the way to develop the future IT Security concepts and technology roadmaps in Ericsson.

 **What you will do:**

* Provide strategic leadership for the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of IT security framework and compliance program.
* Ensure performance, security and other standard methodologies. Steer projects to align to guidelines and directives.
* Lead the development and maintenance of comprehensive IT security policies, standards, and procedures.
* Ensure that security policies are consistent with industry frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST, CIS Top 18, etc.) and regulatory requirements.
* Oversee and supervise compliance with internal security policies, industry standards
* Provide preparation for security related audits & assessments carried out by internal and external audit parties and coordinate the remediation effort of any identified non-conformities / observations.
* Implement and lead a robust IT Security Risk management program, including regular risk assessments and mitigation strategies.
* Collaborate with multi-functional teams to address identified risks.
* Conduct periodic drills and exercises to test the effectiveness of the IT Security Controls.
* Ensure that employees understand and adhere to security policies and procedures.
* Stay abreast of emerging security threats, technologies, and industry trends.
* Recommend and implement improvements to the security framework and compliance program based on evolving risks and challenges.
* The ability to externally and internally convey your proven general security and compliance experience and support Ericsson's security posture to key decision makers.
* Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders on security and compliance matters.

 **The skills you bring:**

* Minimum of bachelor's degree in computer science, cyber security, information security telecommunications or related technical area, or equivalent practical experience.
* Minimum of 18 years experience in information & IT security and/or IT risk management with a focus on security, performance and reliability.
* Relevant certifications such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), or equivalent.
* Solid understanding of industry standards, frameworks, and regulations.
* Exceptional interpersonal, leadership, team management and communication skills including strong listening, negotiation, persuasion and facilitation skills with all levels of leadership and employees.
* Collaborative, team-player with ability to work across domains, in teams, across geographies and cultures. Ability to build effective relationships and excellent social, communication and consultative skills.
* Demonstrable ability to collaborate with multi-functional teams of business, IT and other key partners. Strategic approach with an analytical, structured and result oriented approach.
**Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV/Resume in English.  

Last day to apply: 7th of Feburary 2025  

Location: Sweden or India or US

  

Please note that we do not accept, process, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.

  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Sr. Recruiter, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

  



If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Job details:** Line Manager
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**About Redeploy Insight**  

  

At Redeploy Insight, we provide premium IT-consulting services and specialize in building modern cloud data and AI/ML platforms to enable analytical capabilities that empower enterprise companies in the Nordics to stay ahead of the curve.  

  

With our deep expertise in cloud, data and AI technologies, coupled with strategic partnerships with Microsoft, AWS, and Databricks, we shape the future of data and deliver tailored impactful and scalable solutions of tomorrow.  

  

We believe in our people, collaboration as well as driving business value and technical excellence. Now we’re looking to for a Stockholm-based Senior AI Engineer who wants to be take enterprise AI to the next level.  

  

Can this be the place where you belong?

 **What it means to be a Senior AI Engineer Consultant at Redeploy Insight**  

  

As a Senior AI Engineer with us, you will play an important role in driving our journey to develop the next generation of technical solutions, with a strong focus on AI implementation.  

  

In this role you will take part in client implementation projects, be part of the entire development chain - from idea to deployment of AI Solutions as well as helping and guiding our enterprise clients to become more data and AI driven.  

  

Some of your tasks will include:  

  



* Developing and operationalizing AI solutions, such as RAGs (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and AI agents, ensuring they deliver real value.
* Contributing to **AI-core,** our strategic initiative to help enterprises build platforms that simplify the adoption of AI use cases. Learn more here.
* Shaping the architecture, tools, and design of our proprietary AI platform, enabling seamless integration with modern data platforms.
* Building scalable products and services, leveraging your experience in software development, and expanding across the stack as needed.
* Identifying business problems, translating them into solutions, and ensuring their effective implementation and business value.

 **Who are you?**


We’re looking for someone who pairs technical expertise with strong interpersonal skills, as this role involves working closely with both clients and colleagues. Fluency in both Swedish and English, as well as clear communication and presentation skills are essential to translate complex ideas into actionable solutions for diverse audiences.  

  

Self-leadership, flexibility, and a problem-solving mindset will help you thrive in our fast-paced consulting environment, where client needs and priorities evolve. Collaboration is equally important - you’ll be part of a team that values shared success and leverages each member’s strengths to deliver impactful results.  

  

Your eagerness to learn ensures you stay ahead in the ever-changing AI landscape, driving innovation and value for our clients.  

  

**What experiences do you bring?**  



* A university degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering.
* Proven experience in designing and implementing scalable and performant AI/ML systems or products.
* Strong software development skills and proficiency in one or more programming languages, e.g., Python, Go, TypeScript
* Experience in designing and implementing API services or Web applications.
* Experience in developing CI/CD pipelines for DevOps, MLOps or DataOps purposes.

  

**And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage**


* Understanding of RAG architecture and/or AI Agent architecture.
* Experience of training or fine-tuning LLMs.
* Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and practical experience of machine learning model development.
* Understanding of Lakehouse, SQL Database and/or Graph Database.
* Familiar with Azure, Kubernetes and Databricks.
* Experience in technical consulting projects.

  



  

*Even if you don’t perfectly match the role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe in diversity and inclusion and welcome all applicants with relevant experience and skills.*

  



**What we offer**  

  

Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.  

  

To learn more about our benefits, scroll down

  



**Location**


We have offices located in central Stockholm, at Torsgatan 4. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location.  

  

**How to apply**  

  

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.  

  

We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.  

  

For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.  

  

We look forward hearing from you!

title: Systemtekniker – Microsoft 365 och Infrastruktur
description:
Tillsvidareanställning  

Heltid  

 senast 2025-02-14  


**Ref nr:** ORU 2.1.1-00695/2025


Är du en erfaren och engagerad tekniker som brinner för att arbeta med modern teknologi? Har du förmågan att driva tekniska förbättringsprojekt och samtidigt utvecklas i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning!



Om oss



Avdelningen för digitalisering och IT vid Örebro universitet är navet för universitetets IT-frågor. Vi strävar efter att skapa en modern, säker och kostnadseffektiv IT-miljö som stödjer universitetets mål att vara en ledande forsknings- och utbildningsinstitution.



Vår avdelning ansvarar för både operativ och administrativ IT, med fokus på teknisk infrastruktur, digitala tjänster och användarsupport för anställda och studenter. Med cirka 45 medarbetare är vi organiserade i enheterna IT-service, Drift Infrastruktur och Systemutveckling samt Digital styrning och utveckling. Tjänsten som systemtekniker är placerad inom enheten Drift Infrastruktur och Systemutveckling.



Hos oss pågår flera spännande projekt, inklusive modernisering av datacenter, utveckling av vår IAM-struktur, samt förnyelse av nätverksarkitektur och enhetshantering. Vi befinner oss i en intensiv utvecklingsfas där du får vara med och skapa framtiden med den senaste tekniken.



Arbetsuppgifter



I rollen som systemtekniker för Microsoft 365 kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att vidareutveckla och optimera universitetets IT-plattformar. Du kommer att:


* Förvalta och vidareutveckla Microsoft 365-miljön inklusive SharePoint, Teams och Exchange.
* Proaktivt arbeta med säkerhet, compliance och förbättring av användarupplevelsen.
* Driva tekniska implementationsprojekt och leda omvärldsbevakning för att hålla vår IT-miljö uppdaterad med de senaste teknologierna.
* Ansvara för avancerad felsökning, problemlösning och hantering av komplexa ärenden.
* Fungera som rådgivare och stöd för kollegor i tekniska frågor inom Microsoft 365.

Kvalifikationer



Vi söker dig med gedigen erfarenhet av:


* Microsoft 365-plattformen och dess tjänster.
* SharePoint och Teams.
* Exchange och PowerShell.
* Microsoft Azure och AAD/AD.
* Säkerhet och compliance inom IT.
* Automatisering och effektivisering av IT-miljöer.


Det är meriterande om du har:


* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera IAM-lösningar.
* Certifieringar som exempelvis Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect, Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert eller motsvarande.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av ITIL-processer och -verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med hybridmolnsmiljöer.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda tekniska projekt från start till mål.
* Fördjupad kunskap om nätverksarkitektur, brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar.

Personliga egenskaper



För att lyckas i rollen bör du vara strukturerad, initiativrik och ansvarstagande. Du motiveras av att arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö och har en naturlig förmåga att omsätta verksamhetens behov till tekniska lösningar. Du har ett analytiskt tankesätt och är lösningsfokuserad med en hög kvalitetsmedvetenhet.



Det är särskilt meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att leda team och att ta en ledande roll i tekniska projekt. Vi värdesätter förmågan att inspirera och motivera andra, samt att skapa en positiv och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö. Att kunna agera som en naturlig ledare, ta initiativ till förbättringar och guida teamet mot gemensamma mål är egenskaper som kommer att vara viktiga för att lyckas i denna roll. Din förmåga att kombinera teknisk expertis med ett strategiskt och coachande ledarskap är en betydande tillgång.



Information



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100 % med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och provanställning kan bli aktuellt.



Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Towe Johansson på 019-30 10 74 eller via e-post: towe.johansson@oru.se.



Vid Örebro universitet förväntar vi oss att alla medarbetare är öppna för utveckling och förändring, tar ansvar för sin egen arbetsinsats och kvalitet, visar engagemang att samverka och bidra till utveckling samt visar respekt för andra genom ett konstruktivt och professionellt förhållningssätt.



Örebro universitet arbetar aktivt med lika villkor och jämställdhet och för att vår arbetsmiljö ska präglas av öppenhet, tillit och respekt. Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter mångfald tillför verksamheten.



an



 En komplett ansökan ska innehålla följande elektroniska dokument:


* Ett personligt brev där du berättar varför du är intresserad av rollen som systemtekniker
* Komplett CV
* Kopior av relevanta betyg/intyg


Endast handlingar skrivna på svenska, engelska, norska eller danska kan bedömas.


**Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-14. Välkommen med din ansökan!**

Då vi i samband med den här rekryteringen redan har gjort våra val vad gäller externa samarbetspartners och marknadsföring undanber vi oss kontakt med rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.



Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter måste vi arkivera en omgång ansökningshandlingar exkl. publikationer i två år efter att tillsättningsbeslutet vunnit laga kraft.

title: Program Manager - IT Service - Stockholm, Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
 Role – Program Manager
   

  

 Location – Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Description**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Required**
* 15yrs of experience in Project/Program Management/Service Delivery
* Solid experience in IT Service or Consulting. Preferably from Cloud Infrastructure background.
* Experience working with distributed teams
* Proven track of managing large team and driving complex programs
* Establish and maintain appropriate business relationships with Client and the internal Organization. Act as focal point for assigned Enterprise project-related activities.
* Good grasp of modern Agile/SDLC methodologies and management principles/techniques
* Proven experience in establishing/tailoring project process
* Good understanding of Different Commercial Models, Budgeting
* Experience in budgets and crisis management
* Good planning and organizational skills
* Having a solid understanding of motivational principles and what drives people toward results
* Capability to recognize weak points, risks, and dependencies; ability to address them
* Strong charisma and energy to build the team and, drive it to success, be a role model.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and client relationship management skills
* Advanced level of English (both verbal and written)
* Drive key client Governance forums like Monthly Steering Committee meetings and Quarterly Strategy Reviews.
* Manage the overall CSAT and relationship with the client for the Program.


**About Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

**Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.
   

  

 All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer**

title: System Administrator
description:
We are looking for an experienced resourceful System Administrator that will help us run our production environments as well as maintain our office networks and IT infrastructure.
   

  

 You will be working in a team but also independently so you should have the ability and patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users.
   

  

 Your goal will be to ensure that our technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently and is properly documented and stand up to all security requirements needed for the ISO 27001 standard.
   

  

 The Responsibilities
   

  

* Install and configure Linux environment
* Manage network servers and technology tools
* Set up accounts and workstations
* Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
* Troubleshoot issues and outages
* Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
* Upgrade systems with new releases and patches
* Write and maintain technical documentation, manuals and IT policies


 Who you are
   

  

* Proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator or similar role
* Experience with databases, networks (LAN, WAN) and patch management
* Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
* Familiarity with various operating systems and platforms
* Resourcefulness and problem-solving attitude


**Beneficial Skills And Experience**
* Mysql/maridb, Proxmox, Ceph, Aws, Nagios/Zabbix, Puppet, Nginx, Bash / Python scripting, Firewall/networking/switches, pfsense, Linux ubuntu, Google gsuite, Purchasing, ISMS audits, Vulnerability Scanning, Penetration testing, Internal support


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Systems Administrator Manager - Pharmaceutical Company - Fantastic Working Culture
company_industry: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
**Systems Administrator Manager - Pharmaceutical Company - Fantastic Working Culture** 




  





 We are seeking a Systems Administration Manager to oversee and enhance key systems. This role is pivotal in ensuring the companies systems are optimized for efficiency and aligned with business objectives.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include:** 



* Review systems to identify improvements and align with business goals
* Develop processes and SOPs to enhance efficiency and ensure compliance
* Work with Clinical Operations on projects to meet system needs
* Collaborate with QA to implement SOPs for new systems
* Provide user support and manage compliance documentation



  





**What You Bring to the Role:** 



* Experience in system administration within regulated industries (pharma, biotech, or medical devices)
* Strong understanding of IT security, compliance, and access control
* Skilled in troubleshooting IT issues and managing regulatory documentation
* Excellent teamwork and communication skills



  





 This is an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact by optimizing critical systems and working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
 



  





 ABOUT PLANET PHARMA
 



 Planet Pharma is an American parented Employment Business/Agency that provides global staffing services with its head-quarters in Chicago and our EMEA regional office located in Central London. We have invested significantly in creating a robust international platform that enables us to work compliantly in 30+ countries with a current network of 2500+ active contractors globally as well as a very strong permanent / direct hire recruitment offering.
 



  





 Our specialist knowledge and close relationships with our clients and the wider industry really makes us unique in our field. Just recently we were recognised by FORBES as the 17th best professional staffing firm, and have won multiple awards from industry accredited bodies for our commitment to excellence and service delivery. We have extensive functional expertise including: Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance, QA, QC, Submissions experts, Clinical development, Quality, Biostatistics, and Medical Affairs / Writing.
 



  





 We are an equal opportunities Recruitment Business and Agency. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
 



 www.planet-pharma.com
 



  





 TO APPLY Please click ‘apply’ or contact Harry Budge (Recruiter III) at Planet Pharma for more information: hbudge@planet-pharma.co.uk
 



 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/harry-anthony-budge-a83b96224/

title: Customer Success Manager - Bilingual (Spanish/English)
description:
Let's build the future together!
 
 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by over 10 000 companies, 200.000 users in 90 countries around the world 🌏.
 



 Working at Teamtailor means working at a young, international, and fast-paced tech company that offers an ideal workplace for those who want to have a real impact on the growth of an organization and are craving responsibilities. It also means having lots of fun 🥳.
 



 Building a diverse team with various backgrounds and expertise is at the core of Teamtailor since its very beginning and is truly part of its strength today! There are no typical profiles, each and every team member shares our vision and wants to be part of its success.
 



  

 That's why we're expanding our Customer Success department and looking for a
 **Spanish/English** 
**Customer Success Manager** 
 . Our mission is to have the most satisfied customers and we are looking for a strong relationship-builder to join our team and take care of our Spanish/EU clients 🙌🏼
   

  


 Within the Customer Success department, you find Customer Success Managers, Product Specialists, Promote Specialists, and Onboarding Specialists, who are located in Sweden, Finland, Colombia, the US, and New Zealand 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦.
   





 Your key responsibilities will be to:
 * Implement and onboard new customers.
* Help our customers use Teamtailor at its full potential, with everything from integrations in our marketplace, and best practices to training opportunities.
* Work as a strategical advisor & goal-oriented for our customers.
* Work proactively with renewals.
* Build strong relationships.🤝
* Find new business opportunities with our existing portfolio customers, in the form of expansion sales, upselling/cross-selling. 💰
* Track customer's accounts to identify churn risk and work actively to prevent that risk
* Collect and analyze customers' feedback and present it internally
* Together develop and improve ways of working with customer satisfaction.


 As a Customer Success Manager at Teamtailor, you will be offered:
 * Responsibility for your own customer base
* Incredible development opportunities
* The opportunity to work with the market's best product
* Fixed salary with bonus
* Be part of a great multicultural team.
* Remote work is our DNA


 Is this you?
 * Experience in SaaS
* Experience in HR or Recruiting
* Customer Success Experience 🥷🏼
* Experience in project leading, especially complex projects
* Communication, listening, collaboration, adaptability, empathy, and negotiation skills
* Engaged, creative and solution-oriented
* Have the mindset willing to learn and try new things
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and rapidly- changing market
* Fluent in Spanish and English 🌍
* Extra plus for 
 
 other language 🇫🇷🇵🇹🇬🇧
* A ping pong professional 🏓... we're kidding! But we do like to play in our Stockholm Office.



 We value your personality and we believe you're passionate about your work, ambitious and work hard to reach your own goals!
   





**This was our Company trip last 2022🤩 🤟🏼** 




  





**Interested? 😃**

title: Junior Product Owner
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Collaborate with the Product Owner to develop and maintain comprehensive product documentation, including user guides, feature specifications, and process flows.
* Assist in creating visually compelling presentations for internal and external stakeholders, aligning with brand guidelines and project goals.
* Gather input from cross-functional teams (e.g., engineering, marketing, and sales) to ensure documentation and presentations are accurate and up-to-date.
* Organize and maintain a centralized repository for all product-related materials for easy access by team members.
* Research and implement best practices in product documentation and presentation to enhance clarity and engagement.
* Support workshop facilitation by preparing materials and synthesizing outcomes into actionable summaries


**Application deadline:** 
 04-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: ALTEN Industry - IT Projektledare Stockholm
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Har du ett starkt intresse för teknik och är bekväm med att driva och leda agila projekt på både operativ och strategisk nivå?** 




 Vi på ALTEN Sverige söker nu skickliga IT-projektledare för att leda våra kunder genom en spännande digitaliseringsresa inom flera branscher. Om du är redo för nästa utmaning och vill vara med och forma framtidens teknik, då är detta möjligheten för dig!
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* **Spännande projekt:** 
 Arbeta med digitaliseringsprojekt hos ledande företag inom olika branscher.
* **Personlig utveckling:** 
 Vi värdesätter din individuella utveckling och erbjuder möjligheter att växa genom tekniska utmaningar och utbildningar.
* **Inspirerande gemenskap:** 
 Bli en del av vårt härliga internationella konsultteam med kollegor som besitter olika kompetenser inom IT.
* **Bidra till en hållbar framtid:** 
 Var med och påverka genom projekt som bidrar till hållbar utveckling.
* **Coachande ledarskap:** 
 Våra ledare stöttar dig i din karriär och guidar dig mot dina mål.



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som IT-projektledare hos oss kommer du att:
 



  




* **Driva digitaliseringsprojekt:** 
 Leda och koordinera projekt för att implementera digitala lösningar.
* **Leda tekniska uppdrag:** 
 Säkerställa att projekt levereras enligt uppsatta mål och tidsramar.
* **Driva agila kundprojekt (SAFe):** 
 Arbeta enligt agila metoder för att optimera projektleveranser.
* **Implementera nya integrerade IT-system:** 
 Ansvara för införandet av nya system som förbättrar kundens verksamhet.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi behöver dig som har:
 



  




* **Minst 4 års erfarenhet** 
 av att leda komplexa IT-projekt.
* **Erfarenhet av att driva digitaliseringsprojekt.**
* **Erfarenhet av arbete** 
 med team inom mjukvaruutveckling.
* **Flytande svenska och engelska** 
 i tal och skrift.
* **Utbildning:** 
 Högskoleingenjörsexamen inom relevant område



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* **Starkt intresse för teknik** 
 och innovation.
* **Förmåga att leda och inspirera** 
 team på både operativ och strategisk nivå.
* **Utmärkt kommunikativ förmåga** 
 och vana att presentera för olika intressenter.
* **Strukturerad och resultatorienterad** 
 , med fokus på kvalitet och effektivitet.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* **Certifiering** 
 inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2, IPMA).
* Erfarenhet från större internationella projekt.



  





**Om konsultrollen** 




 Som IT-projektledare hos ALTEN blir du en del av vårt internationella konsultteam där varje medarbetare är viktig för vår framgång. Du kommer att ha varierande arbetsuppgifter och får möjlighet att arbeta med nationella och internationella projekt hos några av våra världsledande kunder. Vi värdesätter dig som individ och arbetar aktivt med din personliga utveckling.
 



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda cirka 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Försvar & Säkerhet, Energi, Industriell utrustning, Public service samt Life sciences. I Sverige är vi cirka 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 9 kontor i 9 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
 



  





 ALTEN har för femte året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av vårt inspirerande team? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Rekryteringsprocessen sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Cloud Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and IT System Design Services
description:
***Senior Cloud Architect - Azure***




***Leading Nordic IT Consultancy Company - Sweden***




  





 Would you like the opportunity to join Sweden's fastest-growing IT organizations in the Nordics, renowned for delivering secure and cutting-edge Cloud solutions to high-profile enterprises and public entities.
 



  





 In the last 3 years they have grown their market leading business to over 500 colleagues, with significant growth and investment occurring in their cloud division.
 



  





 You will be responsible for architecting and programme managing significant multi-tenant cloud solutions for some of the most prestigious companies in Sweden. In the first instance, you will be the lead, working with two significant clients who are in the early stages of a significant cloud transformation.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 5+ years of designing public or hybrid cloud solutions.
* Fluent proficiency in Swedish (spoken and written).
* Good experience of working on or managing significant cloud migrations.



  





  





 My client offers a flexible hybrid position, recognition and rewards programs, plus a highly competitive salary.
 



  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: 2025, Global Network Banking (GNB), Corporate Banking, Placement Analyst, Stockholm, Sweden - February or March 2025 Start
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description:
**You're the brains behind our work.**
 You're ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it's honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can't come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team, and establish a long-term career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when.
   

  

 GNB Bankers are relationship-focused finance professionals responsible for understanding the wide range of complex financial issues facing our clients around the world, originating dialogue on capital structure, liability management, liquidity and funding strategies, risk management and investment solutions. Unique to Citi, Bankers are also responsible for deciding where to invest the firm's capital and executing on those investments, they work in partnership with various Citi groups across the firm including Risk Management, Investment Banking and the Capital Markets Origination.
   

  

 If none of these terms make sense right now, that's ok! You will receive support and education on a variety of these topics to learn the fundamentals of the intern role and introduce you to Citi's culture. So whatever your degree is in we will give you the training you need to excel.
   

  

**We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.**
 We're committed to teaching you the ropes. You will be placed with the Stockholm GNB Corporate Banking team to work with for the duration of the internship.
   

  

**Your time here will look something like this...**
* Assist in client materials (pitches, placemats, account plans, briefings).
* Screening for market up-dates (macro, industry, client related).
* Complete fundamental risk and credit analysis.
* Liaise with product partners across departments and geographies.
* Support Nordic initiatives to help grow revenues and wallet share with clients.


**We want to hear from you if...**
* You are in your penultimate/final year of university or graduated.
* Strong academics.
* Interest in business.
* You are fluent in English and a Nordic language (Swedish, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian).
* You are available to start in February or March 2025


**Who We Think Will Be a Great Fit...**
 A dedication to learning and a true passion for the business are vital. As industries all over the globe continue to restructure and grow, we are hiring professionals who have a global perspective on the future of banking, and want to make an impact on the corporate level. We value diversity and so do you.
   

  

 We'll also be looking for the following:
   

  

* Commitment to personal growth and career development, a strong desire to learn, and success in team environments.
* Knowledge of the global or domestic business landscape is a plus, but not required.
* Strong communication, planning, and organizational skills.
* Desire to develop a deep understanding of the financial industry.
* Unquestioned commitment to integrity ethical decision-making.
* Interest in business.


 We will recruit on a rolling basis and therefore encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Successful candidates will be offered a competitive salary.
   

  

 ------------------------------------------------------
   

  

**Job Family Group:**
 Institutional Banking
   

  

 ------------------------------------------------------
   

  

**Job Family:**
 Corporate Banking
   

  

 ------------------------------------------------------
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

 ------------------------------------------------------
   

  

 Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
   

  

 Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review

title: Functional Consultant
description:
**Role Title** 
 : Functional Consultant
 



**Location** 
 : Flexible, with a focus on Sweden
 



  





**Role Description** 




 We are seeking a
 **senior Functional Consultant** 
 with extensive experience in
 **Kronos Workforce Management (WFM)** 
 and
 **UKG Pro (formerly Kronos Dimensions)** 
 deployments. The ideal candidate will have a strong techno-functional background and a proven track record of successfully delivering multiple global cloud WFM projects.
 



 The consultant will be responsible for leading multiple country deployments (6–7 countries) and providing strategic and technical guidance to teams.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead and manage global
 **UKG Pro/Dimensions** 
 deployment projects with a focus on technical architecture and implementation.
* Serve as a
 **Techno-Functional Architect** 
 to ensure seamless integration and functionality across WFM modules, including pre-scheduling, scheduling, timekeeping, and payroll integration.
* Act as a point of contact and advisor for deployment teams across multiple countries, ensuring project alignment with global objectives.
* Collaborate with technical teams to design, build, and implement WFM solutions tailored to specific business needs.
* Manage and coordinate end-to-end deployment processes, ensuring timelines, budgets, and deliverables are met.
* Provide expertise in
 **Kronos Cloud deployments** 
 , ensuring optimal configuration and system performance.
* Mentor and support technical and functional teams to maintain high project quality.
* Identify and mitigate risks throughout the deployment lifecycle.



  





**Key Competencies** 



* **Technical Expertise** 
 :
* In-depth knowledge of
 **UKG Pro/Dimensions** 
 and
 **Kronos WFM** 
 solutions.
* Strong experience in pre-scheduling, scheduling, timekeeping, and payroll integrations.
* Deep understanding of Kronos cloud infrastructure and deployment best practices.
* **Project Management** 
 :
* Ability to lead multiple country deployments and manage cross-functional teams.
* Expertise in delivering large-scale, global WFM projects.
* **Techno-Functional Skills** 
 :
* Capability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical implementations.
* Hands-on experience in WFM domain architecture and solution design.
* **Communication and Leadership** 
 :
* Strong communication skills in English, with the ability to guide and influence technical teams.
* Experience mentoring junior and mid-level consultants.



  





**Experience & Qualifications** 



* **Experience** 
 :
* 10+ years of experience in
 **global Kronos cloud deployments** 
 , with at least 3 successful implementations.
* 15+ years of expertise in the
 **end-to-end Workforce Management (WFM) domain** 
 , including pre-scheduling, scheduling, timekeeping, and payroll integrations.
* Proven experience as a Techno-Functional Architect in similar projects.
* At least one successful global
 **UKG Pro/Dimensions** 
 deployment.
* **Education** 
 :
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (preferred).



  





**Essential Skills** 



* Extensive experience in
 **UKG Pro/Dimensions** 
 and
 **Kronos WFM** 
 .
* Deep domain expertise in WFM, covering pre-scheduling, scheduling, and timekeeping.
* Proven ability to manage multi-country deployments efficiently.
* Strong techno-functional skills with the ability to design and implement end-to-end solutions.



  





**Desirable Skills** 



* Hands-on experience with payroll system integrations.
* Knowledge of Agile methodologies and project delivery.

title: IT-specialist inom IT-övervakning
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

****Jobbeskrivning****
* Vidareutveckling – av de centrala observerbarhets- och monitoreringsplattformarna.
* Hantera incidenter och problem - analysera och lösa problem och incidenter samt bistå i framtagande av instruktioner för t.ex. incidenthantering. Detta i nära samarbete med 24/7 systemövervakningsfunktionen inom samma enhet.
* Specialist - agera specialist och vara primär kontaktväg för systemspecifika frågor.
* Generell support - support och stöd till andra system, verksamheten och externa parter.
* Genomföra ändringar - hantera beställningar enligt gällande processer och genomföra ändringar i systemen i enlighet med vår changeprocess. Underhålla och genomföra nödvändiga uppgraderingar.
* Dokumentation - arbeta tillsammans med teamet för att säkra god förvaltningsdokumentation och specificera de tekniska krav som ställs på lösningarna.
* IT-säkerhet - arbeta med frågor rörande IT-säkerhet för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, kvalitet etc.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att installera och utveckla IT-övervakningsystem
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet, inom de senaste 3 åren, av att förvalta, installera och utveckla IT-övervakningssystemet Icinga och/eller OP5
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemadministration av Linux-plattformar
* Minst 1 år arbetslivserfarenhet av att scripta med scriptspråket Bash eller Python
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet, inom de senaste 3 åren, att ha arbetat med automatiseringsverktyget Ansible


**Meriterande**
* Minst 2 år arbetslivserfarenhet inom RHEL och Redhat satellite
* Minst 2 år arbetslivserfarenhet inom SE-Linux
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av nätverksadministration (Switching, Routing, firewalls, TCP/IP)
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav (exempel CIS, ISO27002, IEC 62443, ICS/OT)


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 06-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: ALTEN Industry söker dig som vill arbeta som teknisk projektledare
description:
**Är du redo att leda spännande tekniska projekt och driva utvecklingen framåt?** 




 Vi på ALTEN Industry söker en engagerad Teknisk Projektledare som vill vara med och forma morgondagens teknik. Om du har en god förståelse för produktutveckling och processer, samt brinner för att skapa engagemang i ditt team, då är detta möjligheten för dig!
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* **Tekniska utmaningar:** 
 Arbeta med varierande och banbrytande projekt inom mekanik, elektronik, produktion och industrialisering.
* **Personlig utveckling:** 
 Tillgång till en individuell utbildningsbudget för interna eller externa kurser genom vår
 **ALTEN Academy** 
 .
* **Inspirerande gemenskap:** 
 Delta i våra interna nätverk och evenemang där du kan dela erfarenheter och inspireras av kollegor.
* **Coachande ledarskap:** 
 Våra ledare guidar dig i din karriärutveckling och stöttar dig mot dina mål.
* **Bidra till en hållbar framtid:** 
 Var med och påverka genom projekt som bidrar till hållbar utveckling.



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Teknisk Projektledare kommer du att:
 



  




* **Leda och driva team** 
 för att uppnå uppsatta mål inom produktutveckling och processer.
* **Skapa engagemang** 
 bland dina kollegor och säkerställa effektiv kommunikation med både team och kunder.
* **Arbeta strategiskt** 
 för att driva projekten framåt, från att förstå projektets bakgrund och mål till att utveckla aktivitetsplaner och tidsramar.
* **Utreda, leda och följa upp** 
 olika handlingsalternativ samt fatta beslut för projektets bästa.
* **Presentera** 
 för ledningsgrupper och hantera tids- och kostnadsaspekter.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig som:
 



  




* **Har en examen** 
 inom relevant ingenjörsutbildning.
* **Har erfarenhet** 
 av att leda och driva tekniska projekt inom produktutveckling, produktion och/eller industrialisering.
* **Har arbetat** 
 med tvärfunktionellt utvecklingsarbete.
* **Har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet** 
 som projektledare, inklusive erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete.
* **Behärskar svenska och engelska** 
 i tal och skrift.
* **Är skicklig** 
 på att skapa engagemang och har en utmärkt kommunikativ förmåga.
* **Är strategisk** 
 och strävar alltid efter att driva arbetet framåt.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* **Certifiering** 
 inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, IPMA, PRINCE2).
* **Erfarenhet** 
 från större projekt.



  





**Möjliga roller beroende på din bakgrund** 




 Beroende på din erfarenhet och intresse kan du även arbeta som:
 



  




* **Systemtestledare**
* **Scrum Master**
* **Systemingenjör**
* **Systemägare**
* **Produktägare**



  





**Om ALTEN** 




  





 ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda cirka 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Försvar & Säkerhet, Energi, Industriell utrustning, Public service samt Life sciences. I Sverige är vi cirka 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 9 kontor i 9 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
 



  





 ALTEN har för femte året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.

title: Head of Group IT Security/CISO for Confirma Software
description:
**Company Description** 




 Confirma Software is a new Nordic platform acquiring strong enterprise software companies with specialized offerings for SME customers and public sector. The group currently consist of 25 acquired companies. We anticipate continued growth, through acquisition, of 3-6 companies on an annual basis.
 



  





 Confirma Software is backed by Abry Partners, a private equity fund based in Boston, MA.
 



  





**Founded** 
 in 2019
 



**Co-workers** 
  520+
 



**Turnover** 
 100 M€
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is an opportunity to join a quickly growing dynamic organization in the early stages of development into a pan-Nordic powerhouse in enterprise software.
 



  





 We are looking for a person who is a part of a current CISO, IT or IT security team in an organization but feels it’s time to start your own journey as a
 
 Head of Group IT Security
 
 in an organization that is growing rapidly by acquisitions.
 



  





 The
 
 Head of Group IT Security
 
 will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the enterprise-wide security strategy, managing security risks, ensuring compliance with industry regulations, and leading the development of security architectures for a complex landscape that spans software solutions, payment systems, IoT/OT, and SaaS platforms. The individual will be a hands-on leader who can effectively communicate with senior management while empowering and guiding teams across multiple subsidiaries to enhance the organization’s cybersecurity posture.
 



  





 Confirma Software is on a rapid growth journey and this is a corporate role. As a candidate you will have to be flexible and adapt to the different situations as they arise.
 



  





 This is a full-time role. We expect the successful candidate to be located in Sweden, Norway, Demark or Finland. As the group has operating companies in many locations within the Nordic region, the specific location in the Nordics is of lesser importance but travel within the region will be necessary.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





*Risk Management & Governance* 



* Oversee the identification, assessment, and prioritization of cybersecurity risks, implementing risk management strategies across business units.
* Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and frameworks, including NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), ISO 27001/27002, CIS Controls, and PCI/DSS, as applicable to different parts of the business.
* Lead security governance efforts, ensuring that relevant policies, processes, and procedures are in place and followed throughout the organization.



  





*Compliance & Regulatory Oversight* 



* Together with each business, ensure adherence to relevant regulations (GDPR, PCI/DSS, etc.), maintaining secure and compliant operations in debt collection, payment solutions, and public sector software.
* Oversee data privacy and protection efforts, especially in businesses involving sensitive customer and financial data.
* Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure compliance with internal and external standards.



  





*Security Architecture & Technology* 



* Develop and maintain the security architecture for IT systems, IoT/OT environments, SaaS platforms, and software solutions.
* Oversee the implementation of cybersecurity technologies such as firewalls, SIEM, encryption, IAM, endpoint protection, and secure development practices.
* Provide technical guidance to development teams, ensuring DevSecOps and secure coding practices are adhered to.



  





*Incident Response & Threat Management* 



* Lead, mentor, and develop cybersecurity teams within the various companies, ensuring that they are equipped with the latest skills and knowledge.
* Foster a culture of cybersecurity awareness across the organization through training programs, security drills, and awareness campaigns.
* Drive a collaborative security environment, empowering team members to lead security initiatives while providing strategic guidance and oversight.



  





**Key Qualifications** 




  





*Experience* 



* 8+ years of experience in IT and information security, with at least 4 years in a leadership role (CISO, deputy CISO or team lead).
* Experience in leading security efforts in diverse environments, including software development and SaaS. Experience also with IoT/OT and payment systems is an advantage.
* Proven track record of implementing security strategies across multiple subsidiaries or companies with varying business models.
* Strong knowledge and experience with security operations, risk management, incident response, and security architecture.
* It is an advantage if you have knowledge or experience from the financial sector.
* It is an advantage if you have experience from enterprise IT architecture.



  





*Certifications* 



* Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, or CRISC are desired.
* Certifications specific to compliance and governance frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001 Lead Auditor, PCI/DSS QSA) are highly preferred.



  





*Standards and Frameworks* 



* In-depth knowledge of NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), ISO 27001/27002, CIS Controls, and PCI/DSS standards.
* Experience in aligning security programs with legal and regulatory requirements (GDPR, CCPA, etc.).



  





*Technical Knowledge* 



* Hands-on experience with security technologies such as SIEM, firewalls, encryption, IAM, and endpoint protection.
* Strong understanding of DevSecOps practices and secure coding methodologies.
* Familiarity with the security challenges related to IoT/OT systems, including securing embedded systems and industrial networks.



  
 



*Leadership and Communication Skills* 



* Proven leadership abilities to manage cross-functional security teams and drive change across the organization.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex security concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including senior management and board members.
* A collaborative leader with the ability to influence and lead through others, fostering teamwork across distributed teams.



  
 



*Personal Attributes* 



* Hands-On Leadership: Able to roll up sleeves and directly contribute to security operations while guiding teams in our operating companies.
* Strategic Thinker: Capable of aligning cybersecurity initiatives with the broader business strategy, managing risks without hindering innovation.
* Proactive Problem Solver: Able to anticipate security challenges and proactively implement solutions.
* Collaborative and Adaptable: Able to work across our operating companies with differing needs, fostering a security-first culture.
* Language: Fluent ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English is required.

title: Citrix Administrator
description:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.
 



 HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.
 



 It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.
 



  





**Primary Skill Set & Experience:** 




 Overall 12+ years in IT Infrastructure experience with minimum 7+ years in Citrix Desktop and Apps Virtualization.
 



 SME-level skills in implementing & supporting Citrix XenApp/XenDesktop (Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops) in Citrix Cloud, VMware ESX and Microsoft Azure environments.
 



  





**Job Description** 




**Strong Experience Required:** 



* Citrix Cloud - Installing, configuring, managing and troubleshooting complex and large Citrix server sites.
* Administration, engineering, implementation & upgrades of virtualization in the following areas:


1. Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktop which includes XenApp, XenDesktop solutions
2. Citrix Storefront
3. Provisioning Services
4. Citrix Machine Creation Services
5. Citrix WEM Service
6. Citrix FAS
7. Citrix Cloud Connectors
8. Citrix UPM
9. Multifactor authentication in support of Citrix architectures
10. Migrating Citrix solutions from on premise to cloud
11. Experience with complex Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI)
12. Citrix ADC and Citrix ADM
13. Citrix License Server



  





  




* Microsoft technologies: Windows Server 2016\2019, Windows 10, Windows 11, Office365 suite, App-V 5.x, Group Policy, Active Directory, Microsoft RDS Licensing.



**Skills Relative to:** 



* Cloud technologies such as Citrix Cloud, Microsoft Azure and setting up their integration with Azure Cloud.
* Optimizing Citrix performance, scalability, security, high-availability, monitoring, printing and connectivity.
* Managing Group Policy, DNS and DHCP.
* Citrix\Microsoft technologies such as Citrix FAS, Citrix ADM (aka NMAS), Citrix ADC (including GSLB), Certificate authority (PKI), FSLogix, Citrix App Layering.
* Thin client technologies (IGEL, HP, Dell, etc.) and their integration with virtualization platforms such as Citrix, VMWare etc.



**Good to have knowledge on:** 



* Cloud Infrastructure Design Patterns on Microsoft Azure.
* Designing and Implementing the Networking, Data and Storage, Compute, Cloud Security, Cloud Governance, Infrastructure Monitoring and Operations.
* Hybrid Cloud Strategies and Architecture for Microsoft Azure.
* Automation and DevOps.



  





**Certifications:** 




 Citrix Cloud Certifications (Microsoft Azure certifications preferred)
 


* CC-VAD-CC
* CC-VAD-MA
* CCE-V
* CCP-V
* CCA-V
* CCA-N
* Azure Certifications (AZ-900, 104, 140)



  





**Soft Skills:** 



* Ability to communicate professionally and effectively, both orally and in writing.
* Ability to work professionally and productively with all encountered in the course of work, including personnel supporting departments, vendors, and consultants.
* Excellent interpersonal skills.



  





**Benefits** 



* A supportive, diverse, and global team with a brilliant culture.
* Competitive compensation and benefits that includes up to 20 days’ vacation per year, various insurances like Term life and Business Travel insurance. These are apart from the statutory benefits applicable in the country. Employee benefits are regulated by an internal policy that contains full details regarding the entitlement and conditions for the benefits as per the law of the land.
* Great opportunities to make the role your own, upskill yourself and get involved with exciting projects.
* Total Wellbeing is our focus. Alongside your professional excellence, you join the likeminded colleagues to create a larger impact within the company and society at large in your chosen area of passion - CSR Council, Diversity Council, Women Connect, Sparks – Engagement Champion to name a few.
* To know more about us visit – www.hcltech.com

title: Country Manager - Sweden
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Management
description:
**Job Title: Country Manager – Sweden** 




**Location: Sweden** 




  





**About the Company:** 




  





 My client is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. Working with instantly recognisable clients across industries like Manufacturing, Consumer Goods, Communications, and Financial Services this organisation help to transform these businesses, accelerating innovation, and driving growth.
 



  





 This Global organisation are seeking a dynamic, experienced leader to take on the role of
 **Country Manager – Sweden** 
 , where you will play a critical role in scaling our business and driving success in the region.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




  





 As the
 **Country Manager – Sweden** 
 , you will lead the development and execution of the overall business strategy in Sweden. This key leadership role will focus on driving revenue growth, managing a profitable P&L, and building high-performance teams. You will work closely with senior leadership to shape and deliver large-scale, transformational deals for our clients, while growing the company's brand and presence in Sweden. Additionally, you will hold the dual role as the
 **Head of MLEU Vertical** 
 in Sweden, capitalizing on the immense potential in this area.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Drive Growth:** 
 Lead efforts to meet and exceed growth expectations by shaping large, transformational deals and delivering holistic solutions to clients across industries.
* **Leadership & Culture:** 
 Foster a high-performance culture and promote diversity and inclusion within your teams.
* **Cross-Selling & Service Offering Growth:** 
 Ensure the broad portfolio of services, including consulting, digital services, application services, BPO, and infrastructure services, is effectively cross-sold and driven to clients.
* **Client Relationships:** 
 Build and maintain trusted advisor relationships at the CXO level, managing strategic accounts to help clients achieve their business goals.
* **P&L Management:** 
 Take ownership of the P&L, with a primary focus on commercial efforts, including sales strategies, account growth, deal closures, and relationship management.
* **Team Development:** 
 Support and strengthen the client partner, sales executive, and customer relationship manager teams, ensuring success in both client acquisition and account management.



  





**The Ideal Candidate:** 




  





 We are looking for an industry leader with proven experience in driving business growth and managing complex P&Ls. The successful candidate will bring:
 



  




* **20+ years** 
 of experience in IT services, including at least
 **5 years of leadership experience** 
 managing large geographical or client-level P&Ls.
* A
 **proven track record** 
 of successfully exceeding sales and profitability targets in the IT services sector.
* Strong experience in
 **digital transformation** 
 and building high-performing, diverse teams and cultures.
* **Extensive experience** 
 in managing senior-level relationships with Fortune 500 clients and serving as a trusted advisor.
* Expertise in
 **MLEU** 
 , spanning both technology and business themes, particularly within the following key sectors: BFSI, CMT, Healthcare, Manufacturing, and High Tech.
* **Financial acumen** 
 and proven ability to manage costs, profitability, and multi-tower deals in complex environments.
* **M&A experience** 
 is a plus, including strategy, integration, and delivering ROI.



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Engagement- Engineering Manager Tech
description:
Betsson
 

 Group is now looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
**Tech** 
 within t
 



 he
 

 Engagement
 

 Domain
 


  
 



  

 The WoW
   




 As an Engineering Manager at
 

 Betsson
 

 Group, your primary responsibilities will be geared towards building and leading high-performing engineering teams, meaning a lot of your focus will be on our most important asset – our people! You will work closely with your product and design counterparts on the planning and scoping of the product development roadmap, where you will be accountable for the engineering
 

 teams’
 

 delivery. You will also be expected to take ownership and responsibility for the technical stability and performance of the applications under the tutelage of your teams.
 


  
 



  



 A taster of what you will be involved with
 


  
 
  

  
* Build and lead high-performing engineering teams.
  
* Ensure the engineering teams are properly structured, staffed, and possess the right roles and skills.
  
* Drive excellence in engineer recruitment, onboarding and career development.
  
* Foster an engineering culture of ownership, collaboration, and passion for delivering quality products.
  
* Be an active part of the cross-functional leadership team for the area.
  
* Collaborate with other engineering leaders across the organisation to share best practices.
  
* Accountable for the engineering teams’ delivery in terms of both time and quality.
  
* Work closely with your product counterpart(s) and provide a high level of support for product activities.
  
* Define team performance metrics to monitor and report on team productivity
 

 and individual Team Leads and Engineers performance.
  
* Drive the continuous optimisation and improvement of team and development processes.
  
* Take ownership for resolving situations hindering the performance of the teams. 
 

 Be able to deep dive into solutions, when necessary, track and follow up external dependencies.
  
* Advocate and advance modern agile software development practices.
  
* Step into any missing role as and when may be required.
  


  

 You are good with
   

  
* Understanding of .NET technology stack and hosting applications both on premises and in cloud, CI/CD and monitoring, messaging within a micro service architecture, automated QA.
  
* Through collaboration with your architecture and product counterparts, ensure the engineering teams are aware of any strategies, standards and business goals they are expected to follow.
  
* Making sure priorities are clear and followed.
  
* Nurturing product knowledge gain, sharing, and documentation standards.
  
* Nurturing teamwork and collaboration within the domain and with other teams.
  
* Make sure teams are taking part in building product backlog with clear value for technical initiatives, feature suggestions, improvements, automations etc.
  
* Driving ownership and awareness of system health, performance and stability.
  
* Champion technical initiatives for consideration in the product development roadmap.
  
* Establish a strategy to identify and manage technical debt.
  
* Ensuring highly effective
 

 software development with built-in quality assurance
 

 , support and maintenance processes are in place.
  
* Ensuring SLAs
 

 are defined and
 

 being actively monitored and followed
  


  

 You have experience in
   

  
* Mandatory Hands-on experience in software development, ideally in gaming industry, CRM, payments or similar transactional, highly loaded systems.
  
* Planning and leading the delivery of product and technical initiatives. Documenting solution designs, agreeing and following up on dependencies.
  
* Managing engineering teams in terms of employment, professional development, performance evaluation and policies.
  
* Being responsible and accountable for 2+ engineering teams and directly manage Team Leads.
  
* Recruitment and hiring of Team Leads and Engineers
  


  

 What’s in it for you?
   


 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 


  

  
* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
  
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
  
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
  
* Freedom with responsibility
  


  

 Challenge Accepted?
   


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: ICT Operations Manager
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 BNEW SAN Lab Operations provides world class lab infrastructure, networks and HW Services to the R&D organizations. Through our standardized solutions and services, we enable our stakeholders to configure and deploy design and test environments. We provide engineering IT environments supporting more than 23 000 R&D engineers and operate ~50 000 square meters of labs at our sites in Stockholm, Linköping, Gothenburg and Lund in Sweden and globally through sites in several countries.
   

  

 Are you passionate about technology and leadership? Do you want to be an ICT leader and craft the future of the Test Environments to R&D at Ericsson in Gothenburg?
   

  

 Take the challenge and join our team, Lab Site Operations Gothenburg. Our purpose is to deliver lab infrastructure, hardware and radio services to the R&D organizations.
   

  

 We are currently looking for an ICT Operations Manager, or more specifically a Local Operation Manager (LOM).
   

  

**What you will do:**
 The LOM coordinates and drive to completion of delivery requests to Service Area Lab Operations, locally at a lab site with the support of the service teams, according to prioritizations and with focus on quality. The responsibility includes orders from and deliveries to R&D and you will be the local site interface for Service Area Lab Operation to users/stakeholders.
   

  

 Project Management skills are needed when some bigger changes are run in a project format.
   

  

 The role includes deploying new services and align the ways of working across sites with respect to strategic roadmaps. The LOM can also hold global responsibilities toward cross organization alignments for lab sites.
   

  

 Included in LOM role:
   

  

* Monitor backlog (Lab Ops Hardware & Radio Services) and drive deliveries according to prioritizations from the users/stakeholders.
* Secure facility infra structure to meet the user requirements.
* Consulting to Central Operations Manager and ICT Line managers about local site forecasts.
* Monitor and communicate delivery status to the users/stakeholders when required.
* Ensure user satisfaction.
* Execute and communicate Root Cause Analysis (RCA) related to the delivery.
* Act on Lab Operations delivery flow impediments.
* Secure delivery and highlight risks and impediments to the users/stakeholders.
* Limit waiting/wasted time within and between Lab Operations service teams.
* Drive and follow up task forces in the delivery.
* Suggest continuous improvements to processes, services and templates.


**The skills you bring:**
* We believe a successful candidate has good problem solving skills with a focus on quality.
* You have an attention to details and an entrepreneurial and commercial way of thinking.
* We value good presentation and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to see the "big picture".
* In order to meet customer expectations, you bring experience from delivering results.
* General knowledge of Ericsson, Ericsson HW and 3PP HW. Technical skills are needed in order to understand the requirements from R&D delivery.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Göteborg
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 760193
   

  

 ]]>

title: Manager, System Administrator
description:
The Manager, System Administrator reports directly to Head of IT and is responsible for managing user accounts and ensuring system integrity across various platforms.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
**User Account Management**
* Provision, de-provision, and modify user accounts (both internal and external) across a variety of platforms such as Veeva Vault, Trial Interactive eTMF and Simple Trials CTMS, as well as Microsoft 365/Entra AD.
* Address any user or vendor access issues promptly.
* Ensure access permissions and group memberships adhere to regulatory requirements and company policies.
* Identify opportunities to streamline and improve user account management processes, including implementing automation or best practices to enhance efficiency and compliance.


**System Maintenance**
* Conduct regular system periodic reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, system integrity, and fitness for purpose.
* Implement preventative and improvement-focused maintenance to optimize availability and security.
* Coordinate with vendors for support, system integrations, and updates, ensuring adherence to GxP guidelines.
* Assist with system backups and updates.


**Documentation and Compliance**
* Create, review, and maintain detailed, audit-ready documentation for all user provisioning, system actions, and processes.
* Ensure IT systems comply with GxP regulations, company SOPs, and industry standards.
* Support audits by providing required documentation and resolving any identified gaps.


**Collaboration and Support**
* Partner with the Head of IT to identify and implement system improvements.
* Collaborate with ITB-MED departments to ensure efficient and secure access to all systems.
* Offer support for escalated user access issues and inquiries.
* Offer broad IT support to team members in both Sweden and the US.


**Required Qualifications**
