* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, biotech, or a related field. Or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in system administration in a regulated industry.
* Strong knowledge of IT security, access control strategies, and GxP documentation requirements.
* Experience with periodic system reviews and maintaining compliance documentation in a regulated industry.
* Ability to troubleshoot complex IT issues promptly and effectively.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Previous experience in the life sciences, pharmaceutical or other highly regulated industries.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Certifications related to Microsoft 365, Azure, Veeva Vault, or other relevant platforms.
* Bilingual proficiency in Swedish and English.


**What We Offer (Benefits)**
 Competitive pay and benefits such as
   

  

* Excellent healthcare and retirement plans and insurances with ability to exchange gross salary for pension
* Maximum annual wellness contribution
* Parental salary supplements
* Private health insurance and check-ups
* Inspiring facilities & environment working in our new combined lab & office space in “Forskaren”, Stockholm’s new life science centre


**Hiring Process**
 If your background and skills match the requirements for the position, you will be invited to complete a candidate assessment test. Following this, the hiring manager will contact you for an initial interview. As you progress further in the interview process, you may meet with the hiring manager as well as other key individuals. In the final stages, we will request references and your consent for background checks as part of our recruitment procedures.
   

  

 Applications will be processed as they come, so don’t hesitate to submit your application today. We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

***Disclosure***
*Please be aware that there are certain individuals and entities that fraudulently misrepresent to job seekers that ITB-MED has open employment positions when in fact those positions are not available* 
 .
   

  

*We do not recruit or offer positions via text messages, Signal, Facebook, WhatsApp, or any other messaging platforms.*
*ITB-MED does not ask you to send money and/or personal details such as banking information, passport and/or visa information. Should you think you have been a victim, please report the incident to legal(at)itb-med.com*
 ITB-MED, founded in 2016, has grown to over 40 employees across offices in Stockholm and New York. Clinical trials are being conducted globally, with a particular focus on the United States (US) and the European Union (EU), aiming to submit applications for the market authorization of siplizumab. We have expanded rapidly, and in 2024, our Swedish office relocated to a combined lab and office space in “Forskaren,” Stockholm’s new life science center.

title: Senior SAP Consultant
job_function: Engineering, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Job Title: Senior SAP Consultant** 




  





**Location: Stockholm (Hybrid Work Model)** 




  





**Company Overview:** 




 Join one of the largest and most prestigious multinational organizations in the world, renowned for its excellence in delivering top-tier training, certifications, and competitive financial packages. They're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment that encourages professional growth and innovation.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 They're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior SAP Consultant to join their dynamic team in Sweden. In this role, you will leverage your extensive SAP expertise to deliver exceptional solutions and support to their diverse clientele. Your proficiency in S4/HANA and your consultancy background will be critical in driving success in our projects.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and manage SAP implementation, configuration, and support projects across a variety of modules (FICO, SD, MM, ABAP, Fiori, LE, PP, HR, HCM, PM, WM and more).
* Work closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver high-impact SAP solutions aligned with business needs.
* Design, implement, and optimize processes in SAP S4/HANA to improve business performance.
* Provide expert advice on best practices for SAP systems, while troubleshooting and resolving complex issues.
* Conduct system assessments, audits, and upgrades to ensure performance optimization and data integrity.
* Collaborate in hybrid work environments, balancing remote and on-site project demands.



  





**Requirements:** 



* 3+
 
 years of hands-on SAP experience across various modules, with a focus on S4/HANA.
* Relevant SAP certifications.
* Expertise in one or more of the following SAP modules: FICO, SD, MM, ABAP, Fiori, LE, PP, HR, HCM, PM, WM and more.
* Proven track record of successful SAP project delivery, ideally within a consultancy setting.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* Hybrid work mentality: Able to thrive in a blend of remote and on-site work settings.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English (written and spoken).



  





**What’s on Offer:** 



* Join one of the world’s largest multinational organizations renowned for innovation and excellence.
* Access to world-class training and certification programs to continually enhance your skills.
* Competitive salary package with outstanding financial benefits and opportunities for professional growth.
* Collaborative and supportive work culture.



  





***Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.***

title: NIO Space Specialist
company_industry: Retail Luxury Goods and Jewelry, Retail Motor Vehicles, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
Join us as a NIO Space Specialist – Redefine the Customer Experience!
 



  





**We Are NIO:** 




 NIO represents the next generation of smart, high-performance electric vehicles in the premium segment. Our philosophy,
 *Blue Sky Coming* 
 , reflects our belief in a brighter and more sustainable future, and we strive to make a real difference every day, worldwide. Are you ready to join us on this inspiring journey?
 



  





**Our Story and Vision:** 




 Since our founding in 2014, we’ve built a community where the user experience is front and center. Through continuous innovation in technology and design, we offer something unique: smart electric vehicles that make daily life smoother and more enjoyable for our users. As pioneers in battery-swapping technology, autonomous driving techniques, and the innovative Battery as a Service (BaaS) model, we aim to create a seamless car ownership experience centered around the user.
 



  





**Your Role as NIO Space Specialist:** 




 As a NIO House Specialist, you’ll take the lead in planning and executing engaging events that strengthen our connection with users and showcase NIO’s innovative vision. You’ll also ensure smooth daily operations, support user interactions, and maintain our premium showroom environment.
 


* **Event Planning & Execution:** 
 Organize and execute community and showroom events, ensuring alignment with NIO’s values and goals. Set up, manage, and break down event spaces while engaging attendees to promote the brand.
* **Customer Engagement:** 
 Welcome users, provide detailed product and service information, and support test drives with professional demonstrations.
* **Showroom Maintenance:** 
 Keep the space clean, organized, and visually appealing while ensuring vehicles are properly displayed and maintained.
* **Fleet Coordination:** 
 Prepare vehicles for test drives, coordinate maintenance, and track fleet schedules to ensure readiness.
* **Operational Support:** 
 Assist in day-to-day tasks such as scheduling, resource allocation, and supporting seamless test drive and showroom activities.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Work with internal teams to deliver a cohesive user experience and provide valuable feedback for improvement.



  





**We’re Looking for Someone Who:** 



* You put customers first and understand that great service is a mindset, not just a
 
 statement.
* You have several years of experience in retail and premium products, with a passion for EVs.
* You may have a background in event management or promotion.
* You are approachable, open-minded, and easy to communicate with.
* You thrive in team-based environments and naturally collaborate with others.
* You have a winning attitude, a strong service orientation, with a sense of humor.
* You bring positivity, ambition, and a drive to create exceptional customer experiences.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Flexible to work on weekdays and weekends
* Valid driver’s license (B)
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish; adequate English
* Completed high school education (post-secondary education is a plus)
* Previous experience with planning and arranging events
* Previous experience with sales



  





 This is more than a job — it’s a chance to join a dynamic team shaping the mobility experiences of the future. Does this feel as exciting to you as it does to us? Submit your CV (in English) and be a part of NIO’s future!
 



  





 About NIO as a Global Company:
 



 As a global user-focused company, NIO has organized its operations worldwide. Depending on the position you apply for, it may be necessary to involve recruitment managers outside the European Economic Area (EEA), such as from other NIO group companies like NIO Co., Ltd. in Shanghai, China, or NIO USA Inc. in Palo Alto, USA. If data is processed in countries outside the EEA, NIO uses standard contractual clauses published by the European Commission with appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that your personal data is handled according to European data protection standards.
 



  





**Workplace:** 




 At NIO Space Täby, you'll join a vibrant team that values collaboration, innovation, and individual contributions. Together, we strive to push boundaries, embrace new ideas, and continuously improve on our journey toward success. Your future workplace is more than just a location—it's an inspiring space where creativity and teamwork come to life. Welcome to NIO Space Täby at Gustaf Bergs väg 13, 183 34 Täby!
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you and learning how you want to help shape the mobility experiences of the future!

title: Domänarkitekt - IT-säkerhet
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som Domänarkitekt inom IT-säkerhet får du ett av Sveriges mest betydelsefulla uppdrag inom IT-säkerhet, där du varje dag bidrar till en trygg och stabil elförsörjning.
   

  

 Som
 **domänarkitekt inom IT-säkerhet** 
 ansvarar du för att utforma och leda utvecklingen av Svenska kraftnäts IT-säkerhetsarkitektur. Du ingår i IT-arkitekturenheten och arbetar nära verksamhet, IT-divisionen och säkerhetsavdelningen för att skapa lösningar som möter både dagens krav och morgondagens utmaningar.
   

  

 Vi är i dag cirka 600 personer inom IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Din roll innebär strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt arbete, där du analyserar verksamhetens behov och tar fram målarkitekturer och färdplaner för IT-säkerhetsområdet. Du identifierar utmaningar och möjligheter, säkerställer helhetsperspektivet och stödjer projekt och initiativ med din expertis. Genom att vägleda lösningsarkitekter och andra intressenter ser du till att säkerhetslösningarna både implementeras och hålls samman.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Säkerställa att strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för IT-säkerhetsarkitektur kontinuerligt utvecklas och efterlevs
* Utveckla och underhålla målarkitekturer och färdplaner för IT-säkerhetsområdet
* Genomföra behovsanalyser och säkerställa en sammanhållen, robust och ändamålsenligt IT-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Stödja projekt och initiativ i frågor avseende IT-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Samarbeta nära säkerhetsavdelningen och andra funktioner för att uppfylla både interna krav och externa regelverk
* Delta i arkitektforum och bidra till att utveckla gemensamma arbetssätt
* Utvärdera nya teknologier och säkerhetslösningar


 Om dig
   

  

 Du har en tydlig vision för hur IT-säkerhetslösningar bör utformas och en djup förståelse för de komplexa frågeställningarna inom området. Du är strukturerad och målmedveten, med förmågan att skapa tydliga planer och leverera resultat.
   

  

 Med en stabil och trygg framtoning hanterar du utmaningar på ett konstruktivt sätt och vågar stå upp för dina beslut. Samtidigt är du prestigelös och lyhörd, vilket gör att du framgångsrikt kan samarbeta med olika funktioner och intressenter. Din kommunikativa förmåga och resultatorienterade arbetssätt gör att du driver diskussioner framåt och säkerställer hållbara lösningar som möter både verksamhetens behov och strategiska mål. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Vi Söker Dig Som Har En Relevant Akademisk Utbildning, Alternativt Motsvarande Utbildning Eller Kompetens Förvärvad På Annat Sätt, Som Svenska Kraftnät Bedömer Likvärdig. Du Har En Bred Och Gedigen Bakgrund Inom IT-arkitektur Och IT-säkerhet, Med Erfarenhet Av Infrastruktur-, Applikations- Och Klientsäkerhet. Vidare Har Du
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet i rollen som IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt
* Erfarenhet av att utforma och implementera IT-säkerhetslösningar i större organisationer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med målarkitekturer och att utveckla långsiktiga planer
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-säkerhet inom en samhällskritisk verksamhet alternativt verksamhet med mycket höga säkerhetskrav
* Erfarenhet av relevanta ramverk som t.ex ISO27000 och NIST CSF
* Certifiering inom IT-säkerhet, till exempel CISSP
* Certifiering inom IT-arkitektur
* God kunskap inom IAM (Identity Access Management)
* Erfarenhet av säkerhet i OT-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av riskhantering, kontinuitetsplanering och kravställning mot leverantörer


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Viss möjlighet till distansarbete
* Resor kan förekomma i denna tjänst
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 21 februari 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor i vår rekrytering och behöver inget personligt brev, men önskar att du bifogar ditt CV.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning


 För mer information kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Felipe Castillo: felipe.Castillo@svk.se alternativt ansvarig rekryterare på Boxhill Petra Törnblom: 0760036080 / petra.tornblom@bhill.se. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim ST, 010 475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Senior Data Consultant & People Manager
job_function: Consulting, Information Technology, and Business Development
description:
**Are you ready to take your career to the next level? We’re seeking our next People Manager for the Engagement and Advisory unit—a role that combines leadership and hands-on work as a Data professional consultant.** 




  





 As a People Manager, you will build and lead a team of 5-10 consultants, focusing on coaching, career development, and creating a positive work environment. We believe in empowering our managers to prioritize people and clients over administrative tasks.
 



  





 At Capgemini Insights & Data, you will develop both business and technical skills in a supportive work environment that values community and team spirit.
 



  





**What You’ll Do as a People Manager** 




 • Lead by Example: Be the go-to person for our employees, providing guidance and support.
 



 • Individual Growth & well-being: Conduct regular 1-on-1s, helping consultants plan their careers and achieve their goals. You will foster engagement and well-being within your team.
 



 • Balancing Act & Self-leadership: While supporting your team, maintain your own client-oriented work. Utilization and business development are key.
 



 In your day-to-day work, you will be contributing as a Senior Data consultant, wearing different hats depending on the context. But your role and responsibilities are at all times related to Advisory, Project & Engagement Management.
 



  





**What You’ll Do as a Consultant:** 




 • Depending on your role you will work close with our clients and drive initiatives involving data warehouses, analytics, AI, MDM, and strategy development at customer sites.
 



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 




 • You are an experienced data professional within the Data, AI & Analytics field, for example as a delivery manager, business analyst, project manager, program manager or engagement manager.
 



 • You are driven by creating effective teams and contributing by giving the team members the best possible conditions to achieve smart solutions.
 



 • Fluent Swedish skills
 



  





**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE** 




 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance. At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities. Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Databricks and Microsoft Azure or focus on strengthening your leadership skills.
 



  





**APPLICATION** 




 Ready to join our team? Apply Now!
 



  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
 



  





**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**

title: Senior Backend .NET
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Du kommer ingå i ett CRM-team och det är viktigt att man har god CRM kompetens. Det kommer även vara mycket integration med andra bolag som samarbetar i detta projekt vilket gör att både teknisk integrationskompetens samt att ha jobbat cross team och cross bolag är bra
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* C#/.NET
* CRM
* REST API:er
* OAuth2
* MSSQL
* Git
* Microsoft Azure
* Minst ett CI/CD-verktyg
* Infrastructure as Code
* Eventdriven arkitektur


**Meriterande**
* Dynamics 365
* Azure Analytics services
* Azure DevOps
* Terraform
* Cosmos DB
* Azure Functions
* Azure App Services
* Azure Service Bus
* Azure Key Vault


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 31-01-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Sektionschef-sektionen för datacenter och plattformar
description:
**Regeringskansliets enhet för drift och underhåll**
 Förvaltningsavdelningens verksamhet är sedan 1 september 2024 indelad i sex avdelningar. Flera av avdelningarna genomgår en omorganisation som träder i kraft vid årsskiftet. Nu rekryteras till nya befattningar som enhetschefer och sektionschefer vid dessa avdelningar. Digitaliseringsavdelningen består sedan årsskiftet av fyra enheter. En enhet för drift och underhåll, en enhet för utveckling, en enhet för teknisk styrning och innovation samt enheten Kontaktcenter.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Vi söker nu sektionschef till sektionen för datacenter och plattformar. Som chef för sektionen ansvarar du för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av Regeringskansliets datacenter och plattformar. I rollen ingår budget, verksamhets- och personalansvar. Du ingår i enhetsledningen, är en del av enhetens chefsgrupp där du aktivt bidrar till förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete.Sektionen har 18 medarbetare och ansvarar för områdena server, lagring, backup, virtualisering, databaser, plattformar och active directory. Du har också ansvar för it-säkerheten i sektionens leveranser.
   

  

 Sektionens leveranser ska bidra till kontinuitet, tillgänglighet, kostnadseffektivitet och säkerhet enligt väl avvägda nivåer för att möta nuvarande och kommande behov inom Regeringskansliet och utlandsmyndigheterna. Vi arbetar med löpande utveckling av både arbetssätt, kompetens, leverans- och organisationsindelning varför gruppens ansvarsområden kan komma att justeras över tid. I din roll bidrar du till effektivisering genom att verka för en miljö som stimulerar till samarbete samt utveckla sektionens del i enhetens gemensamma arbetssätt och leveranser i takt med förändrade verksamhetsbehov och it-branschens utbud. Som sektionschef företräder du också verksamheten i många olika sammanhang, såväl internt som externt.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom för tjänsten relevant område eller annan lämplig utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer vara relevant för befattningen. Har du även genomgott relevanta ledarskapsutbildningar är det meriterande. Du har även erfarenhet av en chefsroll inom relevant IT-område med leverans-, personal- och budgetansvar. Du har erfarenhet av att både operativt och strategiskt leda grupper/funktioner med infrastrukturnära leveranser och har även erfarenhet av inköp/ upphandling samt av att hantera och förvalta större avtal och leverantörskontakter. Vidare har du kunskap om tekniska lösningar för datacenter och plattformar samt kunskap om ITIL. Du har även kunskap om inköp, upphandling och avtalsförvaltning.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att i offentlig sektor och/eller en global organisation leda och ansvara för arbetsgrupper/funktioner med tekniska ansvarsområden. Det är även meriterande med erfarenhet av att leda arbete med inköp och upphandlingar enligt LOU samt att det är relevant med erfarenhet av relevant arbete inom regeringskansliets IT och digitaliseringsavdelning. Erfarenhet av att leda genom leverans- och projektledare är också meriterande. Det är vidare meriterande att du har kunskap om it-säkerhet och generella ramverk, samt om du har kunskap om tekniska lösningar för hantering av säkerhetsskyddad information. Det är även meriterande om du har kunskap om tjänste-, förvaltnings-, leverans och projektstyrning samt om du har kunskap om it-arkitektur-arbete.
   

  

 Du behöver kunna uttrycka dig mycket väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 I rollen som sektionschef behöver du ha god ledarförmåga och du skapar engagemang och delaktighet. Som ledare visar du tillit genom att coacha och delegera, för att generera lösningar och frigöra medarbetares potential.
   

  

 Du har en förmåga att skapa förtroendefullt samarbete på alla nivåer både internt och externt samt att du värdesätter goda relationer. Som ledare har du även förmåga att omsätta uppsatta övergripande mål till praktisk handling och resultat samt att du har en problemlösande och analytisk förmåga. Du har även en vilja att utvecklas och lära nytt. Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Du anställs tillsvidare med ett tidsbegränsat förordnande som chef. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta tf enhetschef Jens Storberget på 08- 405 39 48. Du är också välkommen att kontakta rekryteringsspecialist Siri Hågefalk på 08-405 87 83. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Jan Wahlströmför ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekrytergingsverktyg
 **senast den** 
**29 januari.**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Dynamics Business Central - Supply Chain Management
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Är du en erfaren specialist inom
 **Supply Chain Management, Dynamics Business Central** 
 och vill arbeta på
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats 2023** 
 , utsedd av Great Place to Work? Sopra Steria är ett ledande IT-konsult- och managementbolag som rankats som
 **topp fem inom Digital Transformation** 
 av Gartner och flera år i rad utsetts till
 **Karriärföretag** 
 , söker nu dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en applikationskonsult med fokus på Dynamics 365 Business Central och med djup erfarenhet inom Supply Chain Management. I denna roll kommer du att leda och driva implementeringar av affärskritiska lösningar som optimerar hela leveranskedjan för våra kunder.
   

  

 Som applikationskonsult inom Supply Chain Management kommer du att arbeta nära kunder i olika branscher och säkerställa att deras leverans- och lagerhanteringsprocesser blir effektiva, automatiserade och skalbara. Med en stark teknisk och verksamhetsmässig förståelse bidrar du till att utveckla affärsprocesser som skapar verkligt värde.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Deltagande i implementationsprojekt från analys till driftsättning, med fokus på Supply Chain
* Genomföra verksamhetsdialoger för att förstå och effektivisera kundens logistik- och lagerhantering
* Leda workshops och processkartläggningar inom inköp, lager, produktion och distribution
* Implementera och konfigurera Business Central med fokus på Supply Chain
* Testning och kvalitetssäkring av lösningar innan leverans
* Utbilda och stötta slutanvändare inom Supply Chain processer
* Dela kunskap och erfarenheter både internt och externt
* Aktivt bidra till utvecklingen av vårt erbjudande inom Supply Chain


**Erfarenheter**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som applikationskonsult inom Dynamics 365 Business Central/NAV med fokus på Supply Chain Management
* Djup förståelse för logistik, inköp, lagerhantering och produktion
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta nära både interna och externa intressenter
* Förmåga att omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar som skapar värde för verksamheten
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 : Sopra Steria erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att påverka din egen utveckling och framtida karriär. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt med engagerade kollegor och kunder, och du kommer att ha tillgång till stöd och utbildning för att ständigt utvecklas inom ditt expertområde. Vi nyttjar även flexibel arbetsplats.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök nu och bli en del av ett företag som ligger i digital framkant, där våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs och där våra värderingar – driv, hjärta, nyfikenhet och kundfokus – genomsyrar allt vi gör!
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller vårt företag är du välkommen att kontakta Mikael Törnqvist, mikael.tornqvist@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
company_industry: Software Development, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Description**
 It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of
 *Inc* 
 . magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500 and 93 of the Fortune 100, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect in Sweden to join our EMEA sales team, reporting to the manager for the Solution Architects team for the region. In this role, the main focus is working closely with our world-class sales team to overcome and remove all technical barriers in the sales process. This trusted technical advisor will help the sales team develop new business by working directly with customers and partners, effectively positioning Infoblox solutions.
   

  

 You’re the ideal candidate if you are a strategic thinker with a strong networking and security background, understand complex SaaS selling, work well independently, and are results-driven.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Build business cases and technical differentiation in sales opportunities by educating customers and partners about Infoblox solution
* Develop pre-sales engineering content—presentations, demos, and webinars—on Infoblox solutions for customer and partner audiences
* Design solutions and architectural diagrams that convey proposed Infoblox solutions, how they will be engineered, and how they will integrate with other vendors
* Educate partner technical sales teams about Infoblox solutions and technologies and when/how they can identify opportunities and position Infoblox solutions to customers
* Work closely with your primary account manager and support the rest of the team in your areas of core competency
* Evaluate and identify new opportunities within existing accounts to expand with more Infoblox solutions


**What you’ll bring:**
* Experience in Cloud/Security space with working knowledge of design and implementation for at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, VMWare, Kubernetes, or HBSS, Nextgen Firewalls, TIPS, IPS/IDS, DevOps
* 3+ years of experience supporting technical sales or 5+ years of experience in engineering or operations networking
* 3+ years of experience in networking technologies, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, LAN/WAN, Routing, Switching, Firewalls, IPv4/v6, UNIX Admin, and experience with switches, routers, and firewalls in Intranet/Internet/Extranet environments
* Strong knowledge of general security best practices and direct experience with at least one security product
* Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technology simply
* Conscientious attitude and dependability, self-starter, ability to work independently while appreciating teamwork and communication
* DDI -- DNS/DHCP/IPAM experience
* CCSP, CISSP, CASP+, CySA+ CEH technical certifications a plus
* Bachelor's Degree
* Fluency in English and Swedish


**What success looks like:**
 After six months, you will…
   

  

* Have a foundational knowledge of our entire product/solution portfolio
* Demonstrate fluency with either on-prem or SaaS-based Infoblox solutions
* Identify 1-2 specialization areas
* Capable of handling primary SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others


**After About a Year, You Will…**
* Demonstrate fluency with all Infoblox solutions
* Capable of handling advanced SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others
* Able to conduct POCs & customer demos with little to no supervision
* Go-to person for specialization area for assigned region


**We’ve got you covered:**
 Our holistic
 **benefits** 
 package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our
 **values** 
 every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.
   

  

**Why Infoblox?**
 We’ve created a culture that embraces
 **diversity, equity, and inclusion** 
 and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out
 **what it’s like to be a Bloxer** 
 . We think you’ll be excited to join our team

title: Nordea Investment Banking - Leveraged Finance (autumn internship 2025, 20 weeks in Stockholm)
description:
**Job ID: 28389** 




 We are looking for interns to join Nordea’s Leveraged Finance team, the leading Leveraged Finance franchise in the Nordics.
 



**About our team** 




 Meet the Leveraged Finance team. Our role is to arrange, structure, underwrite and execute a variety of financing transactions (including acquisition financing) for Private Equity clients. We offer our clients a broad range of financing solutions including bilateral loans, club loans, distributed leveraged loans as well as high yield bonds.
 



 Our teamconsists of c. 35 highly dedicated professionals working across the Nordics. We pride ourselves on our collaborative approach, deep industry knowledge and commitment to excellence as also recognized by our clients, ranking Nordea as the #1 Acquisition Finance team in the Nordics seven times in a row.
 



 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
 



**What you’ll be doing** 




 You will already from day one be included in the structuring and execution of Leveraged Finance transactions. As a part of our team you will get the opportunity to work with Nordea colleagues in a pan-Nordic setup. You will quickly become an integral part of our team and work closely with internal stakeholders and our Nordic and international Private Equity clients. Projects will be in collaboration with other teams within Nordea including Corporate Finance, High Yield & Loan Syndicate, Risk Solutions (derivatives and hedging advisory) and Debt Capital Markets teams.
 



**Main responsibilities in this role:** 



* Conduct detailed financial analysis and modelling
* Prepare high-quality presentations and pitch materials



**Who you are** 




 This is the right role for you if you enjoy learning and trying new things, and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You are honest and dependable, and passionate about doing a great job. As a team member within Leveraged Finance, you are expected to be driven, solutions-oriented and motivated.
 



**Your background and skills include:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a similar field is a prerequisite. It would be ideal if you are enrolled in a Master’s degree.
* Curiosity & Passion: You have a genuine interest in finance and are excited to contribute your unique perspective
* Strong Academic Background: You’re committed to excellence in your studies and ready to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting
* Analytical & Strategic Thinking: You enjoy diving into data and solving complex problems.
* Team Player: You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to learn from others.



 The role is based in Stockholm, and you will be part of our pan-Nordic team of highly skilled professionals who always walk the extra mile to provide our clients with best possible advice and service.
 



**What we offer** 




 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 



**A culture** 
**that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 



**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 




 Submit your application no later than 09/02/2025.
 



 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Philip Essehorn at philip.essehorn@nordea.com .
 



**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 




**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 



**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
 



**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 



**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
 



 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Consulting Manager within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 As a Consulting Manager you will have the opportunity to work within the growing e-health-business supporting our customers on their digitalization journey. You will share your time between leadership/people management of your team and developing our consulting organization and consulting services.
   

  

 In your role you will work closely with a team of consulting managers to ensure the best possible delivery to our customers. You will together be responsible for capacity planning and competence development for the consulting team and for ensuring we have the right skills set and conditions to deliver value to our customers.
   

  

 You will report to the Consulting Director for Healthcare Consulting which is part of our Delivery organization at Cambio.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you, in addition to being an engaged and engaging leader, are result oriented, well-structured, driven and have a strong customer focus. You naturally have good people skills and the ability to build and maintain strong relationships, both internally and externally as well as being a pragmatic team player who enjoys working together with your colleagues.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Experience as a leader and/or project manager, eg within consulting
* Experience from Consulting and/or project management
* University degree within eg. Business or IT
* Very good communication and presentation skills - verbally and in writing in Swedish and English
* Ability to travel for work when required


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience from the Public Sector and/or e-health
* Experience from Sales and business development, preferably within IT/Digitalization
* Experience from forecasting and managing a budget


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: SAP Fiori Consultant
description:
**SAP Fiori Consultant** 




  





 An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced SAP Technical Consultant to join a leading global consulting.
 







 If you have proven experience and looking to continue growing in the SAP Technical domain then we’d love to speak with you.
 



  





 Location: Sweden, Denmark or Norway – Hybrid
 



  





**SAP Fiori Consultant**




  





 Do you have:
 



  





 \*Minimum of 8 years experience within SAP Fiori Development
 



 \*Fluent in Danish, Norwegian or Swedish
 



 \*Architecture knowledge
 



 \*S/4Hana Experience
 



 \*Experience in a client facing role
 



 \*Function knowledge within various SAP modules would be a bonus

title: Change & Transformation Consultant
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Strategic Management Services
description:
Capgemini Invent is seeking skilled and experienced change and transformation consultants to join our Workforce & Organization team.
 



  





**Are you ready to get the future you want?** 




 We are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining the best people to deliver innovative, world-class solutions for our clients. We offer you an opportunity to make your skills, passion, and potential count. We value what you have achieved so far, your experience will help you be at the forefront of innovation and transformation, and together with your colleagues you will continue to grow your skills, explore new areas, and do work that creates true impact.
 



  





 Our
 **Workforce & Organization** 
 team is made up of skilled consultants who work across change and transformation, HR operating model, and strategy and workforce transformations. In this role, you will be responsible for leading, developing and implementing change strategies and initiatives within our client organizations, with a focus on driving successful organizational transformation. You will work closely with our clients to understand their unique business challenges and develop solutions that drive impactful, sustainable change.
 



 We are driven by a shared purpose: Unleashing human energy through technology, data, creative, and innovation for an inclusive and sustainable future. As a valuable leader in our team, you will bring a deep understanding of change management principles and methodologies, as well as extensive experience in project management. You are passionate about driving organizational change and have a proven track record of leading successful transformation initiatives across HR strategy, workforce transformation and generally, technology-enabled change.
 



  





**The person we want to invite to join our mission has:** 



* 7+ years’ experience in consulting and change management, with a strong track record of successful transformation project delivery
* Experience in driving transformation through organizational change management in technology-enabled transformation, HR strategy, operating model and HRIT or workforce transformation and the future of work
* The drive to succeed and ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with clients and cross-functional teams
* A passion for leading, coaching and influencing, both in an internal team environment and in client engagements
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and develop creative solutions to complex challenges
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English
* Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, organizational development)



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement change strategies that align with our clients' business goals/needs and drive successful organizational transformation
* Lead transformation projects from inception to completion, including scoping, planning, execution, and evaluation
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, providing expert guidance and support throughout the transformation process
* Lead and develop more junior colleagues through coaching and mentoring, both in project delivery and as a role model for the team



  





**Opportunities to:** 



* Continue to build and grow your career in a fast-paced, dynamic, diverse, and fun working environment
* Learn, grow, and be challenged. Join a team with the opportunity to work on complex projects and create sustainable change
* Join an international company with opportunities to work across international boundaries spread across 42 countries
* Be bold, try new things, really make a difference, and have fun!



  





 In line with our trust-based culture, Capgemini Invent offers a hybrid working model, and for this role you can be based in either of our attractively located offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg, with readiness to travel to our clients’ sites when needed.
 



  





**Sounds like the next step in your career?** 




 We review applications on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible! Please submit your application and CV in English.
 



  





 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of
 **strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists** 
 who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



 Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent, look us up on Instagram
 **@capgeminiinvent\_swedfi** 
 or listen in to an episode of our podcast
 **Future Sight with Capgemini Invent** 
 , available on Spotify.
 



  





 #LI-DNI

title: Corporate Finance Internship Autumn 2025 - Nordea Investment Banking (10-20 weeks)
description:
**Job ID: 27940** 




 We are looking for a Corporate Finance intern to join our team full-time for 10 or 20 weeks in Stockholm for a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in one of the leading financial institutions in the Nordic region
 **.** 




**About our team** 




 Meet the Nordea Investment Banking – Corporate Finance team. Our role is to provide expert financial advice to clients across the Nordic region, focusing on M&A, IPOs, and other equity-related transactions. We work closely with clients on high-impact deals, helping them navigate the complex financial landscape.
 



 Our Corporate Finance team is part of Nordea Investment Banking, with approximately 100 employees across offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Helsinki, and Oslo. We work in close collaboration with other divisions within Nordea, ensuring seamless service to our clients.
 



 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us
 



**What you’ll be doing** 




 As an intern, you will work alongside a dynamic team of senior and junior colleagues on exciting corporate finance projects.
 **You will get the chance to:** 



* Conduct industry analysis and company valuations
* Assist in the preparation of pitch books and marketing materials
* Support various stages of mergers & acquisitions (M&A) and equity capital markets (ECM) transactions
* Participate in financial modeling and deal structuring
* Contribute to client presentations and meetings



**Who you are** 




 This is the right role for you if you are proactive, self-driven, and eager to learn. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and are passionate about corporate finance. You are ready to take ownership of tasks while working as part of a team to deliver outstanding results.
 



**Your background and skills include** 
 :
 


* A genuine interest in financial markets and corporate finance
* Excellent academic record, preferably in finance, economics, or a related field
* Fluency in both Swedish and English
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills



**It would be ideal if you also:** 



* Have experience with financial modeling or previous internships in corporate finance
* Have a positive, goal-oriented attitude and enjoy taking responsibility



**What we offer** 




 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 



**A culture** 
**that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 



**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 




 Submit your application no later than 09/02/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Alice Arabshahi at alice.arabshahi@nordea.com.
 



**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 




**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 



**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
 



**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 



**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
 



 Only for candidates in Sweden: for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .

title: Credit Risk Business / Data Analysts, Group Credit Management
description:
**Job ID: 26367** 




 Would you like to be part of a Nordic team, developing the future credit processes for our customers? We are now looking for Credit Risk Business / Data Analysts to our High Risk Data & Default Management Team.
 



 We are offering you an exciting opportunity to develop key capabilities at the heart of Nordea. Your work will require you to understand the connection between regulatory requirements, business processes and data to pro-actively drive initiatives and solve complex problems connected to Nordea’s Credit Risk process.
 



**About this opportunity** 




 Welcome to the High Risk Capability team. We are a growing team, driving the development for high risk credit processes (such as default management and early warnings). Our aim is to build sustainable processes and supporting tools that cater for automation through which we enable great customer experiences. You will work closely with team members and relevant stakeholders to drive the implementation of new solutions and processes for business, regulatory and data requirements.
 



**What you’ll be doing:** 



* Building expertise of Nordea’s credit risk agenda, especially within high risk
* Be part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, prioritizing and driving analysis and change initiatives from initiation to successful delivery, in close collaboration with development teams, relevant stakeholders and management
* Ensuring our solutions meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business value
* Identifying and actively proposing improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and enable automation in the area



 You’ll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected. The location can be either in Sweden, Finland, Norway or Denmark.
 



**Who you are** 




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 



**Your experience and background:** 



* At least 3-5 years of experience working with data analysis and / or regulations and business processes within credit risk, preferably within high risk
* As a business analyst you have experience driving change (from gathering business / regulatory requirements to implementation) in an agile environment. You also are strong in documenting and conceptualising requirements in complex environments
* Furthermore, you have experience working with and understanding credit risk related regulations, for example the Capital Requirements Regulation, EBA guideline on the definition of default or similar
* As a data analyst you naturally have a passion for data, working independently with data analysis to produce actionable outcomes with key insights for stakeholders
* Have a professional level of English, both written and spoken
* Have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, building strong relationships with stakeholders across Business and IT



**To succeed in the role, we believe that you:** 



* Can effectively deliver and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Are self-going with a natural “can do” attitude, show ability to learn quickly and have a solution-oriented mindset supported by structured, analytical and creative thinking



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 




 Submit your application no later than 31/01/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Matthew Woodward, matthew.woodward@nordea.com or +46 766960974.
 



 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 



**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 ​For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: SAP-konsult, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats med spännande uppdrag inom SAP?
   

  

 Nu söker vi erfarna SAP-konsulter till vårt team i Stockholm, som är en del av vår nationella SAP Practice där vi jobbar tillsammans med SAP i fokus. Nu sker en renässans inom SAP med SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Technology Platform, Embedded Analytics med mera. Det innebär att företag som använder SAP står inför helt nya utmaningar och möjligheter. Vill du vara med på denna resa?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss på CGI!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som SAP-konsult får du möjlighet att vara en viktig kugge i CGI:s leverans gentemot uppdragsgivare där du ingår i ett team med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. Här får du möjlighet att hjälpa våra kunder att effektivisera och utveckla sina affärsprocesser och systemlösningar med hjälp av de möjligheter SAP som affärssystem ger.
   

  

 Våra uppdrag finns inom till exempel ECC, CRM, S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors och User Experience. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta inom såväl implementationsprojekt, processförbättringar och förvaltningsuppdrag inom olika branscher så som Insurance, Retail och Manufacturing.
   

  

 Våra kunder befinner sig på olika stadier i sina resor mot S/4HANA. En del befinner sig redan i den nya tekniken, några har en pågående förändringsresa och andra har ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. Här kommer du spela en viktig roll i att guida våra kunder i deras förändringsresa.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som redan är SAP-konsult eller har arbetat som SAP key user, och i rollen deltagit i eller drivit utvecklings- eller förändringsprojekt. Om du inte redan har arbetat med S/4HANA är det viktigt att du är nyfiken på det och vill göra en kompetensresa.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har följande:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Svenska och engelska obehindrad i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet eller ett brinnande intresse för ett eller flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Masterdata
* Finance
* Plan
* Source
* Make
* Deliver
* Security
* Analytics
* Technology
* ABAP
* Business Tech Platform (BTP)
* Integration, SAP Cloud Platform Intergration (CPI)
* RPA
* Machine learning
* User Experience (Fiori, Neptune)


**Mer information om tjänsten**
 För den här rollen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. Du bör dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.
   

  

 CGI är ett av världens största oberoende tjänsteföretag inom IT och affärsprocesser och vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP som Guldpartner. CGI har även blivit utsedda till SAP Partner Of The Year de senaste två åren och är en av de största SAP-leverantörerna på den svenska marknaden.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vad bra! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Delivery Lead Manager
description:
**Join Ework Group – a leader in talent solutions!** 




 Ework Group is Northern Europe’s leading independent total talent solutions provider, specializing in IT, telecom, and engineering. With an annual turnover exceeding 17 billion SEK and a listing on Nasdaq Stockholm, we are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit, innovation, and a people-centric approach.
 



 As our
 **Delivery Lead Manager** 
 , you’ll lead a high-performing team responsible for delivering exceptional results for clients and consultants. You will inspire collaboration, foster innovation, and drive operational excellence in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
 



**What you’ll do:** 



* **Lead through change:** 
 Guide your team with confidence, adaptability, and a clear vision during organizational transitions.
* **Foster collaboration and innovation:** 
 Build a supportive and inclusive environment where ideas are encouraged, and cross-functional teamwork thrives.
* **Drive performance and results:** 
 Set ambitious goals, track progress through KPIs, and create a culture of accountability and pride.
* **Align strategy with operations:** 
 Strengthen collaboration between Sales and Delivery functions, ensuring clarity in roles and responsibilities.
* **Mentor and empower:** 
 Invest in your team’s professional growth, providing personalized guidance and fostering development.



**Your profile:** 



* **Leadership experience:** 
 At least 5 years of leading teams with a proven track record of success in driving results and navigating change.
* **Communication skills:** 
 Fluent in Swedish and English, with the ability to inspire and engage diverse teams.
* **Strategic mindset:** 
 Skilled in setting clear performance expectations and aligning team efforts with organizational goals.
* **People-centric approach:** 
 A natural mentor who empowers teams to thrive and fosters innovation.



  





**Why join Ework?** 




 Be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-growing organization with ambitious colleagues, a supportive culture, and exciting opportunities to make an impact. We are dedicated to strengthening client relationships, enhancing compliance, and driving operational excellence.
 



 📩 Apply today! Screening and interviews are ongoing, so don’t wait. Deadline:
 **2025-02-28.** 




  





 Whistleblowing Policy, which provides guidelines for reporting misconduct can be found on Ework website: https://www.eworkgroup.com/about-us/our-responsibility

title: Total Rewards SME - Job Architecture
description:
**Job Description**
 We are on a journey to create the best people organization in the industry. We created a new People Life Cycle team as a part of our Central People Organization with the objective to deliver the most impactful, holistic and customer centric colleague journey. People Life Cycle is home for a diverse group of HR Subject Matter Experts, who work together towards our common people strategy and vision.
   

  

 Total Rewards is part of People Life Cycle and consists of teams focusing on Core Compensation, Pension & Benefits, Executive Compensation and Global Mobility. As a Total Rewards SME – Job Architecture, you will be part of the Core Compensation team and will report to the rewards function head, Manager of Reward. As an SME for the area, you will be owning the H&M Group Job Architecture Framework, further developing, implementing, and maintaining the job catalogue, ensuring through strong governance alignment with the business goals, industry standards and the connected people life cycle processes.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Job Architecture Ownership: Further develop, implement, and maintain the organization's job architecture framework.
* Governance: Establish and enforce a governance process for job architecture, including job evaluation, levelling, and titling standards.
* Job Catalogue Management: Secure periodic maintenance and updates of the existing job catalogue, ensuring accurate and up-to-date catalogue structure and classifications.
* Job Architecture Integration: Enable the core framework integration and utilization by other people processes. Collaborate cross-specialist areas to enable a coherent and meaningful colleague journey based on the job architecture foundations.
* Calibration Reviews: Facilitate functional and cross-functional calibrations to ensure consistency and fairness in job evaluations across the organization.
* Organizational Design: Participate in major reorg projects by consulting the business on org sizing and levelling. Assess and maintain Mercer based organizational sizing.
* HR and Rewards Partnership: Partner with HR business partners, Rewards Managers and other stakeholders, provide guidance and support on job architecture-related matters.
* Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse job architecture data to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities for improvement. Perform periodic job framework data quality reviews and initiate data clean-up. Update Dashboards.
* Pay Transparency: Actively contribute to the Group Pay Transparency Strategy and Implementation, though proper job catalogue utilization and analysis.
* Continuous Improvement: Lead initiatives to continuously improve job architecture processes and tools, incorporating feedback from stakeholders and staying abreast of industry best practices.
* Training and Communication: Develop and deliver training programs and communication materials to educate HR, Total Rewards, Colleagues and Leaders on job architecture principles and practices.
* Strategic Planning: Contribute to the strategic planning of the Total Rewards function, aligning job architecture initiatives with broader People Life Cycle goals.
* Mercer IPE Methodology: Utilize the Mercer International Position Evaluation (IPE) methodology to evaluate jobs, ensuring a consistent and equitable approach to job evaluation across the organization. Maintain the IPE and internal position levels correlation tables.
* Executive Level Evaluation: Conduct evaluations for executive-level positions, ensuring consistency and sustainable org design. Own the levels and structure for CEO direct reports and grandchildren layer.
* External Benchmark: Organize and run the annual survey submission process. Create and govern a job matching database.
* Vendor Management: Maintain contacts with global vendors and service providers in the area of job architecture and market benchmarks.


**Qualifications**
* Several years of experience in human resources and rewards, with a focus on job architecture, job evaluation, and compensation.
* Business education degree
* Proficient understanding of Mercer job architecture, job analysis, and International Position Evaluation (IPE) methodology.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret job descriptions and lead job evaluation interviews.
* Strong technical skills mainly with Excel and PPT, to be able to manage large databases and prepare presentations.
* Strong organizational agility and ability to understand organizational design, dependencies and business models.
* Stakeholder management and ability to respectfully challenge senior stakeholders during evaluation interviews and calibration meetings.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong problem-solving skills to address job architecture-related challenges.
* Project management skills and ability to lead initiatives and influence stakeholders across the organization.


**Additional Information**
**About the recruitment process**
 This is a full-time permanent role, based at the head-office in Stockholm and you will report to Bilyana Lazarevic, Manager of Reward.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a global family of brands and businesses. We make it possible for customers around the world to express themselves through fashion and design in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M Group here.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Informationscontroller
description:
**Informationscontroller på Folkbildningsrådet** 




 Är du en pedagogisk och strukturerad person som vill göra nytta för samhället och bidra till utvecklingen av folkbildningen? Delar du vårt engagemang för folkbildningens betydelse för samhället? Vi söker nu en erfaren informationscontroller till enheten för verksamhetsstöd.
 



  





**Om Folkbildningsrådet** 




 Folkbildningsrådet är en ideell förening med uppdrag att fördela statsbidraget till folkhögskolor och studieförbund, och att säkerställa att pengarna används på rätt sätt.
 



 Enheten för verksamhetsstöd som består av fjorton personer ansvarar för verksamhetssamordning, informationshantering, processer, HR, ekonomi, IT, registratur och administration.
 



  





**Tjänsten** 




 Som informationscontroller har du övergripande ansvar för att förvalta och utveckla rutiner för informationshantering och informationssäkerhet, diarieföring och arkivering samt efterlevnad av offentlighetsprincipen. Du arbetar tillsammans med registrator och i nära samarbete med IT- och verksamhetssamordnare, jurister och handläggare. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat inkludera att:
 


* ansvara för förvaltningen av diariesystemet Public 360.
* ge stöd till registrator i hantering av inkommande e-post och hantering av begäran om utlämnande av allmänna handlingar.
* hantera fysiskt och digitalt arkiv samt kontakter med Riksarkivet.
* ansvara för rutiner för kansliets samarbete och informationshantering i Microsoft 365.
* ansvara för utveckling och förvaltning av rutiner för det systematiska informationssäkerhetsarbetet.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har mycket god förmåga att skapa struktur och utveckla arbetssätt och rutiner. Du är pedagogisk och har god förmåga att bygga förtroende och relationer. Du är trygg och professionell i din yrkesroll. Du har mycket god kommunikativ förmåga både i tal och skrift. Vi förutsätter att du är en van IT-användare och att du kan bidra i arbetet med att utveckla användningen av AI i arbetet.
 



  





 Vi tror att mångfald i alla dess former berikar vår arbetsplats och att olikheter stärker vårt sätt att arbeta tillsammans. Därför arbetar vi med att vara en inkluderande arbetsplats och välkomnar alla sökande, oavsett bakgrund.
 



  





**De här kvalifikationerna söker vi hos dig:** 



* utbildning inom arkiv- och informationsvetenskap alternativt gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som dokumentcontroller eller motsvarande.
* erfarenhet av förvaltning av digitalt diarium eller ärendehanteringssystem. Erfarenhet av förvaltning av Public 360 är meriterande.
* god kunskap om Microsoft 365
* erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet



  





 Om du vill bidra till en hållbar samhällsutveckling genom arbete med informationshantering och informationssäkerhet, ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





 Start: Omgående eller efter överenskommelse.
