title: Software Developer – Fluid Flow
description:
We are looking for an experienced engineer, physicist, or applied mathematician with a strong background in computational fluid dynamics (CFD) to join our team of developers at our newly renovated office in central Stockholm.About COMSOLCOMSOL develops cutting-edge mathematical modeling software that powers innovations in physics and engineering. Our flagship product, COMSOL Multiphysics®, is widely used across all fields of engineering, manufacturing, and scientific research to model multiphysics systems. Our customers leverage our software to understand, predict, and optimize product designs and processes. Founded in Sweden in 1986, COMSOL has expanded globally with 16 offices and a distributor network, employing more than 500 people worldwide.Role OverviewThe CFD team is responsible for developing new functionality and maintaining existing features in COMSOL Multiphysics’ fluid flow and heat transfer modules. These products are used worldwide by engineers and researchers in industry, research labs, and academia for designing and developing applications across various fields.Additional responsibilities include contributing to marketing plans and supporting global sales efforts. Occasional travel to Europe, Asia, and the U.S. is expected to support the sales and marketing organization.QualificationsWe are looking for individuals with a strong interest in mathematical modeling, computational physics, and software development. Applicants should have:
   

  

* A Ph.D. in engineering, physical sciences, or applied mathematics, specializing in fluid mechanics
* Experience in software development


 The ideal candidate should have expertise in:
   

  

* Turbulent flow
* Multiphase flow
* Flow in rotating machinery
* Non-Newtonian fluids
* Nonisothermal flow
* Reacting flow
* Finite element methods


 Experience with COMSOL Multiphysics and knowledge of object-oriented programming are advantageous. Additionally, familiarity with asymptotic methods for solving nonlinear partial differential equations is beneficial for developing new applications and validating simulation results.Working at COMSOLAt COMSOL, new team members quickly become essential contributors to ongoing development projects. As the company continues to expand, there are plenty of opportunities for employees to advance in their roles and become leading experts in their areas of focus. This journey will be accompanied by experienced colleagues and a collaborative working environment.In addition to an exciting career working on a sophisticated software product, we offer:
   

  

* A competitive salary
* Individual pension plans
* Sponsored gym membership
* Great work-life balance


 To ensure a smooth onboarding process, onsite presence is required. Once onboarded, hybrid work options are available.To ApplyDoes this sound interesting? Submit your application, including university grades, using the form below. Kindly note that applications submitted through other channels will not be considered.For more information, contact Mats Nigam at tel. 08-412 95 00.We review applications continuously.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
* Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.



  





**Skills We're Looking For:** 




  




* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
* Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.



  





**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Senior Java Software Developer
description:
**Introduction** 

 Smartoptics provides innovative optical networking solutions for a new era of open networking. We focus on solving network challenges and increasing the competitiveness of our customers. Our customer base includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments and thousands of enterprises.
 



  





 The candidate will be part of the R&D team. The R&D team develops complete systems including both hardware and software.
 



  




**Position summary** 

 We are looking for a senior developer for the SoSmart software suite, https://smartoptics.com/products/sosmart/. The team is multinational, but this position is seated in our Stockholm office. We are working agile according to the SAFe methodology. Some possibility for work from home, but most days we try to meet in our office in Kista, Stockholm.
 



  




**Required skills** 
* Experience of Java 17+
* Development experience on Linux
* Experience of Test-Driven Development, for example Unit test with Mockito
* Based in the Stockholm area
* Exam within relevant field, e.g. MSc in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
* Good communication skills in English, preferably also in Swedish



  




**Considered beneficial** 
* Experience from work with larger module-based Java projects together with Karaf and Maven
* Micro-service architectures and containerization (e.g. Docker)
* Experience with REST APIs
* End-to-end testing with Python
* Experience of Git and Gerrit
* Experience with network technologies (IP, Ethernet, DWDM)
* Experience with SDN (software-defined network) architectures and related protocols (e.g. RESTCONF, NETCONF and gNMI)
* Knowledge of agile development



  





 Smartoptics R&D team is located in Kista with head office in Oslo, Norway. Benefits include pension, health insurance, bonus scheme, 6 weeks’ vacation and flexible working hours. For more information about Smartoptics, please see 
 **smartoptics.com/about** 
 .
 



  





 Furthermore, note that you must have a Swedish/EU work permit. No relocation assistance or visa support provided. No recruiters or agencies, please.
 



  




**About Smartoptics** 

 Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company founded in 2006. We provide innovative optical networking solutions for the new era of open networking. Our focus is on solving network challenges and enhancing the competitiveness of our customers. Our clientele includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments, and thousands of enterprises.
 



  





 At Smartoptics, we value inclusivity and prioritize the well-being of our employees. We foster a positive company culture and provide a supportive work environment.

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**About Redeploy Insight**
 At Redeploy Insight, we provide premium IT-consulting services and specialize in building modern cloud data and AI/ML platforms to enable analytical capabilities that empower enterprise companies in the Nordics to stay ahead of the curve.
   

  

 With our deep expertise in cloud, data and AI technologies, coupled with strategic partnerships with Microsoft, AWS, and Databricks, we shape the future of data and deliver tailored impactful and scalable solutions of tomorrow.
   

  

 We believe in our people, collaboration as well as driving business value and technical excellence. Now we’re looking to for a Stockholm-based Senior AI Engineer who wants to be take enterprise AI to the next level.
   

  

 Can this be the place where you belong?
   

  

**What it means to be a Senior AI Engineer Consultant at Redeploy Insight**
 As a Senior AI Engineer with us, you will play an important role in driving our journey to develop the next generation of technical solutions, with a strong focus on AI implementation.
   

  

 In this role you will take part in client implementation projects, be part of the entire development chain - from idea to deployment of AI Solutions as well as helping and guiding our enterprise clients to become more data and AI driven.
   

  

 Some of your tasks will include:
   

  

* Developing and operationalizing AI solutions, such as RAGs (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and AI agents, ensuring they deliver real value.
* Contributing to AI-core, our strategic initiative to help enterprises build platforms that simplify the adoption of AI use cases. Learn more here.
* Shaping the architecture, tools, and design of our proprietary AI platform, enabling seamless integration with modern data platforms.
* Building scalable products and services, leveraging your experience in software development, and expanding across the stack as needed.
* Identifying business problems, translating them into solutions, and ensuring their effective implementation and business value.


**Who are you?**
 We’re looking for someone who pairs technical expertise with strong interpersonal skills, as this role involves working closely with both clients and colleagues. Fluency in both Swedish and English, as well as clear communication and presentation skills are essential to translate complex ideas into actionable solutions for diverse audiences.
   

  

 Self-leadership, flexibility, and a problem-solving mindset will help you thrive in our fast-paced consulting environment, where client needs and priorities evolve. Collaboration is equally important - you’ll be part of a team that values shared success and leverages each member’s strengths to deliver impactful results.
   

  

 Your eagerness to learn ensures you stay ahead in the ever-changing AI landscape, driving innovation and value for our clients.
   

  

**What experiences do you bring?**
* A university degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering.
* Proven experience in designing and implementing scalable and performant AI/ML systems or products.
* Strong software development skills and proficiency in one or more programming languages, e.g., Python, Go, TypeScript
* Experience in designing and implementing API services or Web applications.
* Experience in developing CI/CD pipelines for DevOps, MLOps or DataOps purposes.


**And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage**
* Understanding of RAG architecture and/or AI Agent architecture.
* Experience of training or fine-tuning LLMs.
* Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and practical experience of machine learning model development.
* Understanding of Lakehouse, SQL Database and/or Graph Database.
* Familiar with Azure, Kubernetes and Databricks.
* Experience in technical consulting projects.


*Even if you don’t perfectly match the role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe in diversity and inclusion and welcome all applicants with relevant experience and skills.*
 🤝
 **What we offer**
 Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.
   

  

**To Learn More About Our Benefits, Scroll Down 👇🏼**
**📍** 
**Location**
 We have offices located in central Stockholm, at Torsgatan 4. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location.
   

  

 📩
 **How to apply**
 We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
   

  

 We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.
   

  

 For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.
   

  

 We look forward hearing from you!

title: Azure DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik och skapa nya tjänster och automationer för Advanias kunder inom Cloud Transformation? Är du teknikdriven, gillar att samarbeta i ett tight team och vill arbeta med Azure och moderna utvecklingsverktyg? Då är detta din chans!*
**Som Azure DevOps Engineer på Advania**
 Du blir en del av vårt team Special Solution Group, som är en del av Advanias största affärsområde, Managed Services Provider.
   

  

 Hos Advania får du möjlighet att arbeta med:
   

  

  

* Automation och utveckling i Azure: Utveckling av tjänster och lösningar för deras Azure-erbjudanden med hjälp av verktyg som t.ex. Azure DevOps.
* Kundleveranser och lösningar: Stödja deras kunder i att etablera och optimera sina molnmiljöer.
* Möjlighet att bidra till arkitektur och säkerhet beroende på intresse.


 De arbetar i mindre team med stort fokus på samarbete och innovation.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 2–3 års erfarenhet av Azure och är van att arbeta med molnautomation och utveckling.
* Har erfarenhet av verktyg som PowerShell, Azure DevOps, och gärna även Bicep. Erfarenhet av TypeScript eller andra programmeringsspråk är meriterande.
* Har en bakgrund inom infrastruktur och har gått mer mot automation och utveckling.
* Talar flytande svenska.


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Problemlösare: Du gillar att ta dig an utmaningar och hitta kreativa lösningar.
* Lagspelare: Samarbetar gärna och stöttar dina kollegor för att nå gemensamma mål.
* Kommunikativ: Du är tydlig och van att arbeta i en miljö där mycket sker på distans.
* Resultatinriktad: Du ser till att få saker gjorda och levererar med kvalitet.


**Varför Advania?**
 Advania erbjuder en innovativ arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, där du får möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens teknik. Här blir du en del av ett sammansvetsat team som prioriterar samarbete och personlig utveckling. Dessutom får du chansen att utvecklas inom området Cloud och arbeta med den allra senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut.
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Professionals Nord. De kommer att sköta rekryteringsprocessen och alla frågor kring tjänsten går via ansvarig rekryterare Jennifer Ahlberg, jennifer.ahlberg@pn.se alternativt till info@pn.se
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Lead iOS Developer
description:
Bokadirekt is currently in the middle of an exciting expansive phase and here, you will be part of an innovative and modern workplace where dedication is strong!
 



  





**About Bokadirekt** 




 Bokadirekt is Sweden's largest app and marketplace for booking mainly beauty and health. With more than 20,000 connected specialists across the country, they make almost all of Sweden's salons and receptions bookable in one place. This includes, for example, hairdressers, masseurs, podiatrists, beauty salons, chiropractors, and much more.
 



  





 At bokadirekt.se, consumers can search, book, and pay for treatments and services with just a few clicks. Every month, 5 million consumers visit bokadirekt.se, and almost 2 million bookings are made via their website and apps.
 



  





 Bokadirekt is growing and employs over 100 people with offices in Stockholm and Luleå.
 



  





**The role** 




 Bokadirekt is looking for a Lead iOS Developer to join their team and play a key role in building and evolving their mobile applications. As a Lead Developer, you will not only contribute to crafting elegant, scalable, and high-performing iOS apps but also guide and lead a small team of developers. You’ll have a central role and take part in technical decision-making and ensuring seamless collaboration between product, design, and engineering teams to deliver exceptional results.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Lead the development of iOS applications, ensuring high-quality, scalable, and maintainable solutions.
* Support, mentor, and guide a team of iOS developers to help them grow and perform at their best.
* Take accountability for your team’s deliverables, including task grooming, estimation, and planning.
* Collaborate closely with product and design teams to understand user needs and transform them into technical solutions.
* Partner with other teams to deliver cross-functional initiatives effectively.
* Stay up to date with iOS development trends, ensuring the team follows best practices and leverages the latest technologies.



  





**Main technologies** 



* Swift
* UIKit
* Swift Concurrency
* SwiftUI



  





**To succeed in the role, we believe you have experience in:** 



* 5+ years as a mobile developer, including extensive iOS development experience.
* A proven track record of working in high-performing product teams for over 5 years.
* Working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver user-centered solutions.
* Organizing, growing, maintaining, and modernizing iOS apps effectively.
* An interest in app architecture and scalability, ensuring apps are prepared for growth and change.



  





**Why join Bokadirekt?** 




 This is an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about mobile development and thrives on collaboration. You’ll have the chance to work on meaningful projects at the heart of Bokadirekt while mentoring others and influencing technical strategies. If you’re ready to take your career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





*Bokadirekt is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Security Engineer Cloud
description:
Hej där! Vi är Svenska Spel, techbolaget som kombinerar innovation med säkerhet för att erbjuda trygga spelupplevelser i världsklass. Vi hanterar miljontals transaktioner varje dag och för att säkra våra avancerade system söker vi nu dig som vill vara med och forma framtidens molnsäkerhet. Som Security Engineer Cloud blir du en nyckelspelare i vår resa för att utveckla och skydda vår molninfrastruktur.
   

  

 I den här tjänsten kan du arbeta från något av våra kontor i Solna eller Visby, eller på distans från just din bostadsort. På Svenska Spel gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Du kommer att spela en central roll i att säkerställa att Svenska Spels molnplattformar och tjänster är skyddade mot hot och uppfyller våra säkerhetskrav. Du stöttar utvecklingsteam i att integrera säkerhet i speltjänster och ansvarar för att designa, implementera och underhålla säkerhetslösningar för vår molninfrastruktur.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden Inkluderar**
* Designa och implementera skyddsmekanismer som övervakning, identitetskontroll, dataskydd och nätverkssäkerhet
* Identifiera och åtgärda säkerhetsbrister samt hantera sårbarhetsskanning
* Stödja DevSecOps-processer och samarbeta med utvecklings- och driftsteam
* Övervaka och hantera säkerhetsincidenter
* Ständigt hålla dig uppdaterad om aktuella hotbilder och arbeta med att mitigera dessa i våra molnplattformar


**Är du den som kommer att göra det?**
 Vi söker dig med några års erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet inom plattformarna AWS, Azure och GCP. Du har erfarenhet av säkerhetsverktyg, t.ex. AWS Security Hub, Microsoft Defender for Cloud eller Google Cloud Security Command Center.
   

  

 Du är en stark spelare inom säkerhetsrelaterad tooling, t.ex., CI/CD-tooling, kodscanning, SIEM, IAM och containerskydd och har en bred teknisk grund att stå på. Du har också goda kunskaper inom säkerhetsramverk som ISO 27001, NIST eller CIS Benchmarks.
   

  

 Som person är du innovativ och analytisk med stark problemlösningsförmåga, och du uppskattar variationen i att arbeta tätt tillsammans med kollegor men även driva eget arbete framåt.
   

  

 Relevanta certifieringar är meriterande.
   

  

**Om tech på Svenska Spel**
 På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.
   

  

**Vi är Svenska Spel**
 Vi är modiga, nyfikna och vi strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör. Vi vill att spel ska vara till glädje för alla – för våra medarbetare, kunder och gäster, för idrotten och för samhället i stort. Vi sponsrar idrottsrörelsen på alla nivåer, förebygger spelproblem och låter vinsten gå tillbaka till samhället.
   

  

 Vill du läsa mer om våra förmåner som anställd? Då hittar du dem här.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering på något av våra kontor i Solna eller i Visby, eller från någon annanstans i Sverige om det fungerar bäst för dig.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsterna, kontakta Tonny Hultberg, tonny.hultberg@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på hur vår rekryteringsprocess ser ut? Kika in här.

title: Senior Core Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Title**
 Senior Core Platform Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
*Do you want to work with the latest technologies and highly skilled colleagues, at a world leading company?* 
*Then you might be the one we are looking for to join us at Technologies, one of the departments within Axis R&D, with responsibility for developing Axis product platforms that are the base for all Axis Video Surveillance Products.*
**Who is your future team?**
 Product Platforms is a key part of the Technologies department at Axis R&D. Currently, it consists of four highly skilled and motivated R&D teams based in Lund, featuring a great mix of junior and senior team members. Our teams value personal growth, collaboration, and teamwork. If you're someone who enjoys making an impact and contributing to positive change, you'll feel right at home with us.
   

  

 We are now expanding and building a new team in our Stockholm office to strengthen our capabilities.
   

  

 The Product Platforms team in Stockholm will play a vital role in developing and configuring the software for Axis' new technology platforms based on our in-house engineered ARTPEC system-on-chips, which will be used in our next generations of video surveillance products. The platforms we develop are Linux-based and the the development environment is also Linux. The initial work for the team will focus on requirements, design, implementation, and validation of the boot, security and CPU subsystems. In addition to working closely with some of the Product Platform teams in Lund, the new team will also collaborate closely with the ASIC team based in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What you’ll do here as Senior Core Platform Engineer?**
 In your daily work, you will typically engage in the following activities:
   

  

* Collaborate with ASIC design engineers to research and develop solutions for Axis´ ASIC and product platforms, in particular the SW aspects;
+ Participate in design reviews, technical discussions and specifications to ensure the quality and feasibility of solutions.
+ Design, implement or utilize test environments needed to validate and/or optimize our solution designs.

* Prepare SW for and participate in bring-up and validation of our SoCs. This includes debugging issues and implementing solutions.
* Evaluation of hardware blocks, platforms and related documentation (mainly from a SW perspective, Linux kernel in particular).
* Interact with internal and external teams (e.g. customers, partners or suppliers).
* Participate in development and maintenance of existing Linux kernel platforms (e.g. previously developed platforms and products).


 In this role, you will (together with skilled colleagues) mainly be working in the following areas:
   

  

* IP evaluation and selection (primary responsibility).
* All kind of engineering activities related to Linux kernel development (e.g. driver development, kernel configuration, upstream activities, provide domain expertise to other teams, etc).


**Who are we looking for/Who are you?**
 You are an analytic and dedicated person with a strong personal drive and an ability to work both unsupervised and as a part of a team. You have the ability to think ahead and understand and manage consequences of complex decisions or findings. You are good at collaborating with people with different backgrounds (e.g. ASIC engineers, other SW teams, external partners and managers) and have a strong attention to detail.
   

  

**Required qualifications:**
* A master’s degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering or similar.
* Background in Linux kernel development.
* Experience in embedded C development and debugging, particularly close to hardware.
* Familiarity with version control systems and code review tools (Git and Gerrit).


**Additional valuable qualifications:**
* Experience in working with Linux kernel upstream.
* Background including SoC design work from a SW perspective.
* ASIC IP configuration experience.
* A good understanding of the boot process of embedded devices.
* Basic understanding of ASIC design.
* Experience from using QEMU as a tool to make a system simulation environment.
* Experience with Python and Rust development.


 The position is office-based and you will be located in Axis office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What Axis Have To Offer**
 Openness might be a buzz word in other companies, but at Axis this is the core of who we are. Our most important asset is our ability to cooperate. We have realized that great ideas can come from anywhere. This is why we encourage everybody to contribute and innovate. If you are a person that likes to get involved and make a difference and nudge the world a little bit in the right direction, you will find a home with us.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to be part of building our new R&D office in Stockholm. On one hand, having the advantages of being a small and agile site while at the same time being part of an exciting, successful organization that is already the world leader in network video.
   

  

 We offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning fika every day, company bonus, attractive wellness benefits, health insurance - to name a few.
   

  

 We hope you are really inspired by the job description and found a potential match! We are looking forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions, get in touch with Erik Thored, Engineering Manager for the Common Core Platforms team, at +46 46 272 1800.
   

  

 Type of Employment
   

  

 Permanent Employment
   

  

 Posting End Date
   

  

 2025-02-21
   

  

*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* 
*Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
**About Axis Communications**
 We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
   

  

 With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
   

  

**Let´s create a smarter, safer world**
 For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
   

  

 Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
*Are you prepared to join Dustin's Dynamics team in a leading role to shape the future of Dynamics 365 CE in an international setup? Step into a collaborative environment where innovation thrives, and your contributions make tangible impact.*
**This is what makes the position as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer unique**



* Lead with setup and maintenance of Dustin's new Dynamics 365 CE platform, working closely with key stakeholders to maximize business value and innovation.
* Take ownership of designing and delivering innovative technical solutions that drive business transformation.
* A collaborative environment where a "win as a team" attitude prevails, fostering growth and success collectively.



 The team is a group of 13 brilliant professionals, with current operations live in BNLX and an exciting project underway in the Nordics. We encourage a welcoming and collaborative environment, with a mix of personalities and an international team, ensuring everyone works together to achieve success.
 



***Read more about Dustin here***




**Your role & influence as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer** 




*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for leading the development and technical operations of Dynamics 365 CE, including managing releases, coordinating connected ISVs, ensuring code quality, coaching the team, maintaining Dynamics environments, troubleshooting issues, and driving technical excellence.
 



*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of delivering seamless Dynamics 365 CE solutions and technical releases, ensuring high-quality outcomes through collaboration and teamwork, while working closely with departments IT and Business Stakeholders to ensure alignment, resolve challenges, and deliver impactful solutions
 



 Core activities:
 


1. Leading technical development and ensuring smooth solution releases.
2. Conducting design reviews, troubleshooting, and maintaining environment stability.
3. Collaborating to align technical solutions with business needs while fostering team growth.



**Benefits of joining Dustin** 




 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   





 You can find more of our Swedish benefits below in the vacancy.
 



****This is what we imagine you bring****




 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who combines senior-level expertise in Dynamics 365 CE, .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Power Platform, and Azure DevOps with excellent communication skills and a passion for collaboration and problem-solving.
 



 Additionally, it's nice that you have:
 


* Bachelor's degree level of working and thinking and 5 years’ or more experience of similar job.
* Experience with API integrations, Dual Write, and release pipelines.
* Strong technical skills in Azure services like Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Service Bus.
* Proficiency with SQL Server and related database management tasks.



****What can you expect next?****




 We will treat your application anonymously. We expect the following steps in the recruitment process:
 


* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with Hiring Manager, Christian Nilsson and a colleague.
* Technical (Second) interview with future colleagues from the team.
* A possible final Interview with Direction Application Management, Sara Wennerström.
* Professional References.



**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer** 




 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com
 **.**

title: Senior Data Modeler
description:
**Job ID: 26594** 




 We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland, and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
 



 We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.
 



 We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues and meeting our potential candidates.
 



 We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on the broader perspective in our daily challenges.
 



 We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 



**About our team** 




 Meet the Common Data Warehouse Requirements and Analysis team. We are responsible for building the bank’s Common Data Warehousing solution using state of the art cloud solutions. We add value by providing expert analysts and data modelling capabilities and expertise in the data warehousing and data integration areas for many solutions in the bank based on cloud-based technologies like Snowflake, and many other modern technologies.
 



 Our team specializes in data analysis, data modelling, and data architecture. As IT Analyst you will play a crucial role in project development lifecycle.
 



 Our technology stack includes, but is not limited to: Snowflake, DataStage, ETL Architecture, Cloud-based databases, Data Mesh, Data Vault.
 



 We are looking for an IT Analyst (Data Modeller) to perform data analysis and data model transformation tasks. You will be working as an interface between business and IT to help translate the business requirements into IT mappings, as well as help understand data patterns and design innovative solutions.
 



**What you will be doing:** 



* Perform complex data analysis to help IT clarify requirements towards business and test use cases
* Map source data to target data models in the most optimal way (financial services logical data model)
* Act as technical SME and help IT development teams in understanding the requirements



 This is the right role for you if you have a passion for data analysis and problem solving. You are exceptionally good in interpersonal communications and proficient in English language.
 



**Your background and skills include:** 



* A degree in Computer Science or related field.
* At least 5 years’ experience in IT.
* Have worked with requirement management.
* Experience of working in multinational virtual teams.
* Understanding of Data Warehousing industry standards.
* Understanding of ETL/BI/Data Analytics/Data Modelling processes.
* Experience in writing SQL.
* Have good English language skills to freely communicate with stakeholders
* Communicative Swedish language skills



**It would be ideal if you also:** 



* Having experience with Snowflake
* Having knowledge of Data Mesh, Data Virtualization, Data Vault
* Having experience working in SAFe environment.



**What we offer** 




 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics, and traits make us stronger together. We offer a full-time employment agreemen with various benefits based on your location, which may include private health and life insurance, learning opportunities, holiday subsidies, bonuses, special banking offers and many more.
 



 We treasure flexibility. That is why we offer a hybrid working model, where you can experience both working from our offices and from home (2-3 days from the office).
 



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 




 Submit your application no later than 31/01/2025.
 



 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Łukasz Borek.
 



 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
